Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Bark

Bark is revolutionising the way people find professionals in over 1,000 unique categories. As the UK's largest and fastest-growing services marketplace, we're on a mission to make finding the right professional quick and easy. With a presence in eleven countries and plans for further expansion, joining us at this genuinely exciting time will be a journey like no other.




Our cutting-edge technology ensures that you can always find the best professional for any job. With a talented team of over 200 dedicated individuals, we're committed to providing exceptional service and ensuring that our customers are satisfied every step of the way.

This is an exciting time to join our scaling business, we recently placed in the Sunday Times Best Places to Work 2024, and previously were 64th in the Sunday Times 100 fastest growing private tech companies in 2023.




As a profitable scale-up, Bark is in a unique position to offer the best of both worlds; the excitement and agility of a start up combined with the financial security and backing of a renowned private equity firm, EMK Capital. You'll have ownership, agility, responsibility and stimulation without any of the worry.




About the Role

We are looking for an enthusiastic and forward-thinking Product Data Analyst to join the Data & Insight (D&I) Team at Bark. The D&I Team plays a pivotal role within Bark, providing recommendations, insights, and strategic learnings to internal stakeholders across the business. We‚Äôre particularly looking for someone who has a track record of leveraging analytics to deliver business value, ideally with experience in a marketplace business environment.




Your focus will primarily be with the Product function, helping to drive better business decision-making through data-driven insights. You will report on product experimentation, enabling the Product squads to better serve our customers, and provide recommendations that help shape the customer experience across the Bark platform. You will also be a key contributor to progressing the D&I team‚Äôs experimentation processes, techniques and capabilities. We are passionate about delivering value to our Buyers and Sellers in new ways, so curiosity and a desire to understand the unique behaviours of our users on both sides of the Bark marketplace are essential for success in this role.




You will also work closely with the broader D&I team, developing a wide understanding of all facets of the business. This could involve showcasing results from experiments, providing actionable recommendations to cross-functional teams, and identifying opportunities for improvement across different areas. Each quarter you will also work on one or more initiatives with your teammates to develop novel analytical capabilities and techniques for use within the business, focusing on advanced techniques or emergent technologies such as LLMs and AI.




Responsibilities

Assist in the design, implementation, and analysis of A/B and multivariate experiments across product and commercial initiatives, applying statistical rigour to quantify impact.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product Managers, Engineering, and D&I colleagues to identify priorities, coordinate timelines, track progress, and share results.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that highlight key metrics and experimental outcomes.
Translate complex data findings into clear, actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proactively seek opportunities to improve processes and increase efficiency within the product development and analytics lifecycles.




Required Skills and Experience

Advanced knowledge of SQL (Google Standard SQL, MySQL or similar relational database language).
Familiarity with Google BigQuery or another large-scale data warehouse solution.
Experience using Tableau (or similar) to create and manage data sources, and present complex insights clearly.
Highly competent in Python for data analysis tasks.
Deep understanding of statistical concepts and tests, with the ability to discern appropriate application.
Significant experience in designing and rigorously analyzing experiments (e.g., A/B tests) using statistical methods.
Ability to clearly communicate technical findings and recommendations to different audiences.
Comfortable managing multiple projects in a high-performance environment.
Ability to work under pressure, adapt to shifting priorities, and maintain high attention to detail.
Strong collaboration skills and the ability to build effective cross-functional relationships.
Eagerness to learn and continually develop new skills.
Experience working in a fast-paced environment and delivering high-quality outputs under tight timelines.




Perks and Benefits

Fully remote working
Personal annual L&D Budgets with ‚Ç¨500 to spend on your development
Access to Oliva - a mental wellbeing platform
Work from home set up budget
Being at the forefront of an industry with new and exciting problems to solve




Interview Process

Screening Call with Talent Partner (30 mins)
1st Stage - Hiring Manager Stage (30/45 mins)
2nd Stage - Technical Task (60 mins)
3rd Stage - Values interview (30 mins)




Diversity Statement

At Bark, we are a platform for people, revolutionising the way professionals and individuals connect since 2014. Our culture is defined by excitement, ambition, and a commitment to raising the bar. We value diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB) and are dedicated to embedding these principles into everything we do. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, and our focus is on hiring, retaining and developing a globally diverse workforce that is passionate about excelling our platform and supporting our customers succeed. Be part of our dynamic team, where bold ideas thrive, and create a future worth shouting about.

Title: Data Analyst Intern (Python & API Focus)
Description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.

The Team:

The Business Analytics team uses our own Celonis software to do data analytics globally for the entire Go To Market organization. This situates the team in an advantageous position, bridging the gap between business operations, technical solution development, and product development as power users of our own Software. For anyone in data analytics, this is a great opportunity to grow and continue a career since Celonis is the industry-leading in process mining technology.

The Role:

As an Intern, you will play a key role in shaping analytics and data products that drive strategic decision-making, business performance and optimization across multiple internal business units. You will work hands-on with new product features, sometimes even before they are publicly released, and help push the boundaries of data analytics capabilities to create valuable and impactful solutions.

As an Intern, you will contribute to projects focused on developing a technical solution to enhance the visibility and performance of the team in charge of creating sales opportunities. You will gain a practical understanding of how data-driven insights and scalable data tools can enhance the operations to drive results. This internship offers a unique opportunity to collaborate with system teams, Go-to-Market business managers, and Strategy & Operations teams, applying your analytical and technical skills to contribute to impactful solutions within a fast-paced environment.

The work you‚Äôll do:


Gather, process, and analyze business data using company technology, ensuring data is structured to support business goals, needs, and opportunities.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular data quality checks, validation processes, troubleshooting and enhancements to maintain reliable datasets.
Integrate multiple data sources into our Celonis platform using Python and API calls to develop a technical solution that enhances the business development team's visibility and performance through a purpose-built tool in our platform.
Build actionable insights and recommendations to drive better business outcomes.
Enable the team to effectively use the tool by bridging the gap between data metrics and business meaning, ensuring informed decision-making.
Participate in internal initiatives aimed at enhancing data ingestion, data quality, model development, tool creation, and the development of enablement materials and documentation. These collaborations will focus on optimizing data solutions to increase their efficiency, effectiveness, and overall value for the organization.


The qualifications you need:


On going studies in Data Science, Engineering, Big Data /Business Analytics or a comparable technical degree program with outstanding performance.
Proficient in utilizing SQL, Python, and/or BI tools for data analysis and visualization
Experience in working with data ingestion, data transformations, databases and data visualizations is a plus
Working experience in the enterprise software industry is a plus
Think analytically, work in a structured manner, and quickly comprehend new topics and complex interrelationships to present and explain them to our stakeholders in a reliable and independent manner.
Possesses a strong intrinsic motivation to take ownership of tasks and a proactive approach to managing responsibilities, demonstrating the ability to identify key priorities and follow through with determination. Exhibits the potential to prioritize their workload and take accountability for their contributions.
Demonstrates proactive communication skills and a willingness to bridge the gap between technical concepts and business objectives. Shows initiative in seeking to understand business needs, effectively communicate ideas, and engage with stakeholders. Eager to learn and apply their initiative to contribute meaningfully to team goals and drive impact.
Have very good knowledge of spoken and written English (German and/or Spanish are a plus)
Available from ASAP


What Celonis Can Offer You:


Pioneer Innovation: Work with the leading, award-winning process mining technology, shaping the future of business.
Accelerate Your Growth: Benefit from clear career paths, internal mobility, a dedicated learning program, and mentorship opportunities.
Receive Exceptional Benefits: Including generous PTO, hybrid working options, company equity (RSUs), comprehensive benefits, extensive parental leave, dedicated volunteer days, and much more. Interns and working students explore your benefits here.
Prioritize Your Well-being: Access to resources such as gym subsidies, counseling, and well-being programs.
Connect and Belong: Find community and support through dedicated inclusion and belonging programs.
Make Meaningful Impact: Be part of a company driven by strong values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future.
Collaborate Globally: Join a dynamic, international team of talented individuals.
Empowered Environment: Contribute your ideas in an open culture with autonomous teams.


About Us:

Celonis makes processes work for people, companies and the planet. The Celonis Process Intelligence Platform uses industry-leading process mining and AI technology and augments it with business context to give customers a living digital twin of their business operation. It‚Äôs system-agnostic and without bias, and provides everyone with a common language for understanding and improving businesses. Celonis enables its customers to continuously realize significant value across the top, bottom, and green line. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany, and New York City, USA, with more than 20 offices worldwide.

Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.

Celonis Inclusion Statement:

At Celonis, we believe our people make us who we are and that ‚ÄúThe Best Team Wins‚Äù. We know that the best teams are made up of people who bring different perspectives to the table. And when everyone feels included, able to speak up and knows their voice is heard - that's when creativity and innovation happen.

Your Privacy:

Any information you submit to Celonis as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Celonis‚Äô Accessibility and Candidate Notices

By submitting this application, you confirm that you agree to the storing and processing of your personal data by Celonis as described in our Privacy Notice for the Application and Hiring Process.

Please be aware of common job offer scams, impersonators and frauds. Learn more here.

  • Connect and Belong: Find community and support through dedicated inclusion and belonging programs.
  • Make Meaningful Impact: Be part of a company driven by strong values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future.
  • Collaborate Globally: Join a dynamic, international team of talented individuals.
  • Empowered Environment: Contribute your ideas in an open culture with autonomous teams.

About Us:

Celonis makes processes work for people, companies and the planet. The Celonis Process Intelligence Platform uses industry-leading process mining and AI technology and augments it with business context to give customers a living digital twin of their business operation. It‚Äôs system-agnostic and without bias, and provides everyone with a common language for understanding and improving businesses. Celonis enables its customers to continuously realize significant value across the top, bottom, and green line. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany, and New York City, USA, with more than 20 offices worldwide.

Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.

Celonis Inclusion Statement:

At Celonis, we believe our people make us who we are and that ‚ÄúThe Best Team Wins‚Äù. We know that the best teams are made up of people who bring different perspectives to the table. And when everyone feels included, able to speak up and knows their voice is heard - that's when creativity and innovation happen.

Your Privacy:

Any information you submit to Celonis as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Celonis‚Äô Accessibility and Candidate Notices

By submitting this application, you confirm that you agree to the storing and processing of your personal data by Celonis as described in our Privacy Notice for the Application and Hiring Process.

Please be aware of common job offer scams, impersonators and frauds. Learn more here.

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:
The HP Personalization & Industrial Business (PIB) offers an integrated portfolio of Services that enables predictable printing operations and optimized cost structure. It allows our customers to maximize press uptime, increase productivity, and grow their business.

The EMEA Competency Center is part of this organization, and our focus is to give support to our customers and help them to grow.

Our team actually giving support to the local service teams that are delivering onsite support to the HP Indigo customers. As part of our responsibilities we need to ensure that the knowledge is transferred from GBU to the local service teams. From our team we develop and deliver programs to help customer growth and improve current processes in the organization.

Responsibilities


Usage of different platforms to manage Data.
Creation of automatic reports to extract data that supports the organization in their operations and decisions
Creation of Dashboard in different platforms (Power BI, Tableau, Service Now) to cover the needs of the organization.


Education, Skills And Experience Required


Last year of Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science and Engineering
Fluent English.
Good presentation skills
Understanding of the printing industry
Office 365 expertise
Customer oriented
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in language to be supported.
Experience in troubleshooting in a technical environment.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.
Software and hardware knowledge of computing, storage and peripheral devices.
Advanced proficiency with case management databases and tools.
Superior customer service skills.
LEAN knowledge (preferred)
Analytical thinking and problem solving skills.
Software and hardware knowledge of computing, storage and peripheral devices.


What We Offer


Curricular Internship agreement between university, company, student
Flexible schedule for part time (4h/day) or full time (8h/day) for a 3 to12 months agreement
A Young employee Network (YEN) which host fun events on a regular basis; such as ‚Äúbeer bust‚Äù Fridays at different venues including the beach in the summertime.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy and general health
Free daily printing Happy hour ‚Äì from photographs, to large posters. And Hands-on workshops to print with the latest technology ‚Äì from wall covers to 3D printed models

Title: Junior Data Analyst - Porto
Description:
Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade ‚Äì this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We‚Äôre focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

Job Description

Join our team and start a new adventure in an international and dynamic environment, where you will be able to fulfil your career expectations in a fast growing organization.

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will be part of our corporate team, working closely with various departments to transform data into insights and value-added solutions that support strategic decision making and improve performance across the organization.

Your missions



Design, develop and deploy machine learning models to solve business problems
Collect, clean and process structured and unstructured data from multiple sources
Perform statistical analysis and predictive modeling to uncover trends and patterns
Develop dashboards and data visualization tools to communicate findings
Collaborate with IT and business teams to integrate models into operational systems
Validate models and ensure robustness, scalability, and reliability
Stay up to date with the latest data science trends, technologies, and best practices
Document solutions, prepare technical reports, and present results to stakeholders



Your profile



Academic background: Master‚Äôs degree or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or similar
Experience with data manipulation and analysis using Python and libraries like pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn
Proficiency in machine learning algorithms and statistical modeling techniques
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Plotly
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and databases (SQL, NoSQL)
Fluent English. French is a plus.
You are analytical, curious, and business-oriented, with excellent communication skills



What We Offer



An international community bringing together 110+ different nationalities
An environment where trust has a central place: 70% of our key leaders started their careers at the first level of responsibilities
A robust training system with our internal Academy and 250+ available modules
A vibrant workplace that frequently gathers for internal events (afterworks, team buildings, etc.)
Strong commitments to CSR notably through participation in our WeCare Together program



Remote policy: Possibility to work remotely up to 2 days per week

We are proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Job Description

Join our team and start a new adventure in an international and dynamic environment, where you will be able to fulfil your career expectations in a fast growing organization.

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will be part of our corporate team, working closely with various departments to transform data into insights and value-added solutions that support strategic decision making and improve performance across the organization.

Your missions


  • Design, develop and deploy machine learning models to solve business problems
  • Collect, clean and process structured and unstructured data from multiple sources
  • Perform statistical analysis and predictive modeling to uncover trends and patterns

  • Stay up to date with the latest data science trends, technologies, and best practices

  • Fluent English. French is a plus.
  • You are analytical, curious, and business-oriented, with excellent communication skills


What We Offer


  • An international community bringing together 110+ different nationalities
  • An environment where trust has a central place: 70% of our key leaders started their careers at the first level of responsibilities
  • A robust training system with our internal Academy and 250+ available modules
  • A vibrant workplace that frequently gathers for internal events (afterworks, team buildings, etc.)
  • Strong commitments to CSR notably through participation in our WeCare Together program


Remote policy: Possibility to work remotely up to 2 days per week

We are proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Ecolab Company has an opening for an Data Analyst Trainee in our Procurement Analytics and Digital Solutions (ADS) team located in Barcelona, Spain. If you are a passionate professional that is seeking opportunity, advancement, and a rewarding learning chance and career we invite you to apply. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a highly recognized global growth company offering competitive compensation and benefits in addition to career growth.

Job Overview

As a part of the Data Operations team in the Global Supply Chain Analytics and Digital Solutions group you will be responsible for continuous improvements in digital capabilities and advanced analytics. You will lead the development of new digital products providing critical insights that help solve business challenges. The successful candidate will lead efforts to improve the chemical data understanding across the organization through improved process, governance, and data management.

Candidates must display a passion for systems, data, operational reporting & advanced analytics. The strong performer can expect further career advancement opportunities with Ecolab and will have the chance to move into other roles within Procurement or the organization, with increasing leadership opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to advance your career with a stable growing company!

Main Responsibilities


Serve as a liaison among stakeholders to analyze, document, and validate requirements for reporting and changes to business processes
Develop and maintain data products
Develop, test, and operationalize new standardized reporting
Develop and maintain business intelligence dashboards
Lead automation of processes and analyses
Train other teams in systems, tools, and processes owned by ADS
Proactively make recommendations and identify opportunities to solve business problems through new business intelligence reporting
Interface with IT to specify and implement improvements to our data pipelines


Basic Qualifications


Masters in Data Science or Statistics or Computer Science or equivalent advance degree.
Interest in an Artificial Intelligence (AI) and business intelligence (BI) role
Experience with AI and BI data modeling and presenting insights to key stakeholders.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficient in Python, PySpark, SQL, Azure AI, Tenserflow, Streamlit, Flask, Power Apps, Power BI, Snowflake, Azure SQL Database.
Intermediate SQL skills, or willingness to learn.
Fluent English
Full-time availability.
To be eligible for the Traineeship contract you must have completed your bachelor's or master's degree studies.
Work permit in Barcelona.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience designing and building standard reports and dashboards
History of managing and delivering projects, tasks, and initiatives
Ability to create, implement, document, and continuously improve processes in a changing environment
Training or experience in data science areas such as time series analysis, forecasting, classification, and regression analysis
Experience with data analytics tools such as Python, R, SPSS, MATLAB, Stata, and SAS
Experience working with global cross-functional teams and demonstrated ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical expertise
Microsoft PowerBI experience
Project management experience
Experience in the petrochemical industry a plus
Enrolled in or recently completed degree with emphasis in Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Engineering preferred


Ecolab‚Äôs commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) reflects our longstanding value of working together to integrate diverse perspectives to challenge ourselves, reach our goals and do what‚Äôs right. Disability certificate will be an asset.

Our Commitment to a Culture of Inclusion & Belonging

Ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of Equal Opportunity to Employment. We will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance in all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement. Ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin,citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, or disability.

Title: Data Analyst(They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable


üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft is a global leader in gaming with teams across the world creating original and memorable gaming experiences, from Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Rainbow Six, to Just Dance and more. We believe diverse perspectives help both players and teams thrive. If you‚Äôre passionate about innovation and pushing entertainment boundaries, join our journey and help us create the unknown!

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile‚ÄØbrings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we‚Äôre transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft‚Äôs Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid work model.
Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule:‚ÄØ40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM ‚Äì 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount‚ÄØand Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).



Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender sexual orientation, age or disability status.

  • Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
  • Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
  • Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
  • Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
  • Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.


Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.


  • Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
  • 5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
  • Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
  • Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
  • Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
  • Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
  • Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
  • Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
  • Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
  • Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.


What can make you stand out:


  • Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
  • Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
  • Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
  • Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.


Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)


  • Hybrid work model.
  • Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
  • Flex working schedule:‚ÄØ40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM ‚Äì 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
  • Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
  • Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
  • Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
  • 5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
  • Ticket Restaurant: 200‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
  • Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
  • Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
  • Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
  • Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.
  • Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
  • Ubisoft games with discount‚ÄØand Uplay PC for free.
  • Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).


Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender sexual orientation, age or disability status.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

Are you passionate about transforming raw data into powerful insights? As a Data Analyst, you'll navigate through complex data ecosystems from sources like SalesForce Sales & Service and ERP systems, seamlessly integrating them to create a unified data landscape. You'll spearhead the development of scalable data processes, collaborate with cross-functional teams to incorporate cutting-edge analytics tools, and craft insightful dashboards and reports that drive strategic business decisions.

We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst with a minimum of 5 years of experience to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Business Intelligence (BI) development within a Microsoft SQL environment.

Your role will be critical in partnering with finance, sales, service, and IT teams to align data initiatives with business goals, acting as a data management expert and effectively communicating your findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Additionally, your dedication to data protection and privacy compliance will ensure our business information remains secure and trustworthy.

Your Key Responsibilities

Create, implement, and manage data integration workflows using SQL Integration Services
Develop multidimensional cubes and tabular models in SQL Analysis Services
Generate and distribute reports using SQL Reporting Services
Perform in-depth data analysis and generate insights to support business decisions
Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using Tableau
Work with large datasets and ensure data integrity and quality
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and provide solutions
Create comprehensive documentation and reports to communicate insights and recommendations
Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and security across all BI systems
Continuously improve BI processes and methodologies to enhance efficiency and effectiveness



Who You Are

Minimum of 5 years of experience in a data analysis role
Proven experience with Microsoft SQL Server (SSAS, SSRS, SSIS)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently and meet deadlines
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Statistics, or a related field
Preferred: Experience with Snowflake database
Preferred: Experience developing reports and dashboards using Tableau
Preferred: Familiarity with data structures in SAP


Who we are

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100‚Äô000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.

Let‚Äôs build a healthier future, together.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

We have offices in 34 countries and are developing more than 450 projects thanks to a team of over 15,000 professionals worldwide, including more than 1,000 in our offices in Spain, highly qualified to carry out all types of projects. Since 1972, we have had an operational center in Spain, with our headquarters located in Cornell√† de Llobregat, and we also have branches in Tarragona, Madrid, Castell√≥n, A Coru√±a, Huelva, and Algeciras to provide close and high-quality service to all our clients.

If you are someone motivated by this transformation in the industry and want to develop your talent to build a more sustainable future, contact us!

We are currently seeking a Data Analyst, to join our team based in Barcelona, Spain.

About the role:


Automation of workflows using Python/Power Automate/Power BI.
Development and maintenance of Power BI dashboards for tracking Safety KPIs in Engineering and Construction Projects.
Development and maintenance of Power BI dashboards for tracking Quality KPIs in Engineering and Construction Projects.
Automation of PowerPoint presentation generation with data from Power BI dashboards.
Support in the standardization of Excel files for Engineering disciplines.



About you:

Catch this opportunity and invest in your skills development, should your profile meet these requirements.


Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
Knowledge in the use of advanced spreadsheets, such as Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, macros, etc.).
Degree in areas such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Economics, or related fields.



Languages: English

What‚Äôs next?

At Technip Energies, we prioritize internal applications and provide timely feedback to internal applicants. Our Recruiting Team screens and matches your skills, experience, and potential team fit against the role requirements. We ask for your patience as the team completes the volume of applications with a reasonable timeframe. You can check your application progress directly in PeopleConnect Recruiting.

Together, let‚Äôs be part of the solution!

Title: Data Analyst , External Fulfillment EU
Description:
Description

The EU External Fulfillment Ops Excellence team is looking for a hands-on, detail oriented and highly motivated Data Analyst to help create data backed insights. The data analyst will be responsible to analyze data to support support programs, dig deep into data to determine root cause of defects, build and maintain decision support tools, and present findings to business partners. In addition the Data Analyst will also be responsible for maintaining key metrics for business reviews.

Key job responsibilities

Key Responsibilities


Assist in retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources to support decision-making processes
Help maintain and review KPIs on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis
Support the EU External Fulfillment Network with basic data requests
Contribute to data analysis that informs recommendations for EU EF Leadership
Participate in data mining and basic problem-solving tasks


Basic Qualifications


High school diploma or equivalent (Level 3 according to European Qualification Framework [EQF])
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Ability to work in a team environment
Basic understanding of data analysis


Preferred Qualifications


Problem solving experience
Ability to work independently
Experience with basic data analysis and reporting
Knowledge of Amazon systems and processes
Strong organizational skills
Interest in learning new technical tools
Basic understanding of data visualization concepts
Ability to maintain attention to detail
Good communication skills


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
If you're looking for a change, eager for new challenges, and you're a Data specialist... keep reading, because this opportunity might be just what you're looking for!




We‚Äôre currently looking for a Data Analyst to join a growing Global Digital & Consumer Marketing team within the beauty and lifestyle sector.




You‚Äôll be part of a dynamic, cross-functional team supporting multiple brands across different markets. Reporting to both the Head of Consumer Data and the Consumer Data Tech Director, you‚Äôll play a key role in enhancing consumer insights and improving the overall customer experience across ecommerce and omnichannel platforms.




Key Responsibilities:




Segment customers and perform deep-dive analyses to support targeted campaigns.
Deliver strategic insights to improve customer experience, retention, and growth.
Build and maintain dashboards for performance, CRM, and eCommerce teams.
Automate reporting and promote a self-serve analytics culture.
Analyze marketing campaigns and provide actionable recommendations.
Collaborate with Data Engineering and key stakeholders to ensure data accuracy and availability.




Requirements:




Strong SQL skills and ETL pipeline experience.
Background in statistics or quantitative analysis (Python or R is a plus).
Proficiency in data visualization tools (Looker, Power BI, or similar).
Experience with advanced analytical models and customer & marketing analysis.
Solid understanding of the digital ecosystem and channel attribution models.
Ability to clearly communicate complex findings to non-technical audiences.
Self-starter with excellent time management, high standard of quality and stakeholder engagement skills.




What working with us will offer you:




The chance to take part in challenging projects within a dynamic environment.
A stable position with a clear career path within the company.
Permanent contract from day one.
Full remote work model.
Flexible compensation options and meal vouchers, among other benefits.




If you're interested in this opportunity and would like to know more, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply so we can get in touch, provide you with all the details, and answer any questions you may have.

Agap2 is an equal opportunity employer.




We are committed to treating all applications fairly based on skills, achievements, and experience. We encourage everyone to apply ‚Äî all applications will be considered equally regardless of race, nationality, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About PayXpert

PayXpert is the payments solution built to provide the best experience to any business and in every customer journey.

PayXpert is one of the most prominent Fintech companies in the payments sector. The firm offers innovative payment processing solutions, and currently services 650+ clients, including global brands.

With a wide range of payment processing services focusing on revenue optimization, BI and anti-fraud; as well as alternative payments such as WeChat and Alipay, PayXpert leads the way in payment innovation!

We are invested not only in our clients, but in our employees as well! We believe in equal employment opportunity, a culture built around gender-balanced development opportunities of our professionals, a flexible and healthy working environment, and general equality in the workplace.

PayXpert is part of the Societe Generale Group.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities


Develop proposed projects such as automated processes, reporting improvement, and metrics forecasting, among others.
Design, build and maintain business intelligence infrastructure to improve the availability and usability of data insights.
Work closely on driving strategic initiatives to improve the quality and timeliness of insights.
Build scalable automation solutions utilizing SQL, Python, Power Bi, Grafana among other tools.
Creation of metrics and dashboards for KPIs.
Provide operational support on maintaining the data functionality in current project developments.
Model in large datasets to measure results and propose key indicators.



We offer


Hybrid Model
Team buildings & Workshops
Permanent Contract
Challenging projects: With us, you will have the chance to participate in a variety of technical projects amongst passionate and skilled colleagues
Free languages courses: learn Spanish, French or improve your English skills at your disposal
Learning Solutions According to your needs
Events: we do believe in the importance of meeting our colleagues in an informal and natural environment to build connections between UK & France & Spain. Please take part on our awesome engagement events‚Ä¶
Referral Bonus
Health Insurance Perk
38h working hours per week



Preferred Candidate Profile

Education


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Economics, Computer Engineering, or similar
Bootcamp and/or Computer Science related study
Data Science master‚Äôs degree is a plus



Job Experience


Experience as a data analyst, data science or business intelligence role, focused on building and analyzing large sets of data to solve problems
Python skills for ETL and Machine Learning (pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, requests, plotly)
Intermediate knowledge of SQL
Knowledge of visualization, preferably Power BI and/or Grafana
Prior experience using Git



Professional knowledge


A minimum of 4 years of experience in a data analyst role
Communication and analytical skills
Attention to detail with precise and effective communication
Focus and intuition for understanding the needs of the business



Do you want to join and be at the forefront of innovative Fintech Technologies, Immerse yourself in a multicultural and dynamic environment?

We believe in equal employment opportunity, a culture built around gender-balanced development opportunities for our professionals, a flexible and healthy working environment, and general equality in the workplace.

The personal data collected is intended for PAYXPERT and used to process your application with a view to possibly offering you an employment contract. It is intended for use by the departments responsible for recruitment. This information will be kept for a maximum of 2 years if your application is not successful. In accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of 27 April 2016 on the protection of personal data, you have the right to access, rectify, delete, portability and limit the Processing of Data concerning you. You may also, for legitimate reasons, object to the Processing of your Data. You may exercise your rights by contacting our DPO at the following address gdpr@payxpert.com or at the following postal address Av. Diagonal 440, 08037 BARCELONA, SPAIN. For more information on the Processing of your Personal Data by PAYXPERT, please consult our privacy policy available on our website at the following address: https://www.payxpert.com/privacy-policy/.

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Place: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Description -

The HP Personalization & Industrial Business (PIB) offers an integrated portfolio of Services that enables predictable printing operations and optimized cost structure. It allows our customers to maximize press uptime, increase productivity, and grow their business.

The EMEA Competency Center is part of this organization, and our focus is to give support to our customers and help them to grow.

Our team actually giving support to the local service teams that are delivering onsite support to the HP Indigo customers. As part of our responsibilities we need to ensure that the knowledge is transferred from GBU to the local service teams. From our team we develop and deliver programs to help customer growth and improve current processes in the organization.

Responsibilities


Usage of different platforms to manage Data.
Creation of automatic reports to extract data that supports the organization in their operations and decisions
Creation of Dashboard in different platforms (Power BI, Tableau, Service Now) to cover the needs of the organization.


Education, Skills And Experience Required


Last year of Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science and Engineering
Fluent English.
Good presentation skills
Understanding of the printing industry
Office 365 expertise
Customer oriented
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in language to be supported.
Experience in troubleshooting in a technical environment.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.
Software and hardware knowledge of computing, storage and peripheral devices.
Advanced proficiency with case management databases and tools.
Superior customer service skills.
LEAN knowledge (preferred)
Analytical thinking and problem solving skills.
Software and hardware knowledge of computing, storage and peripheral devices.


What We Offer


Curricular Internship agreement between university, company, student
Flexible schedule for part time (4h/day) or full time (8h/day) for a 3 to12 months agreement
A Young employee Network (YEN) which host fun events on a regular basis; such as ‚Äúbeer bust‚Äù Fridays at different venues including the beach in the summertime.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy and general health
Free daily printing Happy hour ‚Äì from photographs, to large posters. And Hands-on workshops to print with the latest technology ‚Äì from wall covers to 3D printed models


Legal entity: sales and services

Job -

Administration

Schedule -

Full time

Shift -

No shift premium (Spain)

Travel -

Relocation -

Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO) -

HP, Inc. provides equal employment opportunity to all employees and prospective employees, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, sexual orientation, age, disability, or status as a protected veteran, marital status, familial status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic predisposition or carrier status, uniformed service status, political affiliation or any other characteristic protected by applicable national, federal, state, and local law(s).

Please be assured that you will not be subject to any adverse treatment if you choose to disclose the information requested. This information is provided voluntarily. The information obtained will be kept in strict confidence.

If you‚Äôd like more information about HP‚Äôs EEO Policy or your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please click here: Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law ‚Äì Supplement

  • We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy and general health
  • Free daily printing Happy hour ‚Äì from photographs, to large posters. And Hands-on workshops to print with the latest technology ‚Äì from wall covers to 3D printed models

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a data enthusiast ready to make an impact? Join our team as a Data Analyst, where you‚Äôll play a pivotal role in shaping our company‚Äôs future through sharp analysis, strategic insight, and proactive collaboration.

Key Responsibilities

Insight Generation & Analytics


Answer business questions using a wide range of data techniques.
Develop concise one-page documents with actionable insights and business recommendations.
Conduct in-depth analyses to solve key business problems.
Translate complex data into clear and concise presentations for senior management and stakeholders, effectively communicating key findings and recommendations.
Create compelling visualizations to effectively communicate key metrics to stakeholders.


Machine Learning & AI


Develop and deploy machine learning models to solve and automate key business problems and processes.
Foster an AI-driven culture within Holaluz by researching and disseminating AI knowledge across the company.
Stay up to date with emerging technologies and assess their suitability for Holaluz.


Data Warehousing


Populate the Data Warehouse with datasets using Python and SQL to create robust data pipelines.
Optimize and evolve the data warehousing infrastructure to ensure cost-effectiveness and scalability.
Maintain the smooth and efficient operation of Data Analytics systems.


What We‚Äôre Looking For

Education & Experience


A Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Telecommunications, or a related field
3‚Äì5 years of experience working as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist or Data Engineer.


Key Skills & Attributes


Expertise in SQL and Python language.
Analytical and strategic thinking with a proven ability to solve complex problems.
Good communication skills to distill intricate concepts into actionable insights.
Previous experience working with a visualization tool such as Power BI, QlikView, Tableau, etc.
A proactive, detail-oriented professional with a solution-focused mindset.
Team player who thrives both independently and in collaborative environments.
A positive, energetic attitude that aligns with our SHAKE culture:


‚óã Say things as they are

‚óã Have fun

‚óã Always people first

‚óã Keep rowing together

‚óã Es posible

Why Join Us?

This role is more than just a job‚Äîit‚Äôs an opportunity to drive meaningful impact within a fast-paced, forward-thinking organization. If you‚Äôre optimistic, hardworking, and excited to grow within a culture of transparency, collaboration, and possibility, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Title: Data Analyst and Business Strategy - MBA Intern
Description:
At Amenitiz, we‚Äôre on a mission to simplify hospitality management, whether it's in the bustling streets of Paris or the serene Uyuni Salt Flats of Bolivia.

Empowering over 14,000 hoteliers worldwide, we‚Äôre more than just another SaaS scale-up‚Äîwe‚Äôre revolutionizing one of the world‚Äôs oldest industries. With over $50 million raised from top-tier VCs who back disruptive giants like Alibaba, Toast, Zendesk, Delivery Hero, Revolut, and Loom, we've been recognized as a TravelTech Titan and one of Wired's hottest start-ups.

Our team, nearly 300 strong, is based in beautiful Barcelona. At Amenitiz, we cultivate a culture of positivity and personal growth. Our team members are enthusiastic, thrive on ownership, and excel in collaboration. Every day, we lead by example, prioritizing client satisfaction and executing with excellence. We are committed to making a positive impact wherever we go.

As an Data Analyst and Business Strategy Intern at Amenitiz, you‚Äôll be at the heart of our mission to help hoteliers thrive. Your focus? Coordinating strategic projects that drive Amenitiz‚Äôs vision forward, analyzing data to guide decisions, and preparing executive-level presentations that drive alignment across teams and external stakeholders. You‚Äôll have the chance to contribute directly to high-impact projects that shape the future of hospitality tech. This internship offers a hands-on opportunity to learn how strategy is built and executed in a fast-growing SaaS scale-up.

Your mission


Project Management: Help track the progress of key internal initiatives, coordinate meetings, and ensure next steps are clearly defined and followed up.
Data Analysis & Reporting: Assist in gathering and analyzing business metrics to support strategic decisions and performance tracking.
Strategy & OKR Process Support: Support the coordination of our Strategy and OKR cycles by helping prepare updates, track progress, and improve team rituals.
Executive Communications: Help prepare presentations, briefs, and reports for internal leadership forums and external stakeholder meetings, including Board meetings and investor reporting.


About you


Currently pursuing or recently completed a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Economics, Engineering, or a related field.
Analytical and structured thinker: comfortable working with numbers, identifying patterns, and presenting insights clearly.
Highly organized, adept at prioritizing multiple tasks, meeting tight deadlines, and ensuring no detail slips through the cracks.
Collaborative and able to work effectively with different teams, follow up on tasks, and communicate clearly with stakeholders.
Proactive, curious, and eager to learn how a fast-paced tech company operates behind the scenes.
Proficient with Excel/Google Sheets and PowerPoint/Google Slides for analysis and presentations.
Clear communicator in both written and spoken English.


If you‚Äôre a strategic thinker with a passion for driving growth and innovation, we want to hear from you! Apply now to join our team and be a part of our exciting journey at Amenitiz!

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
The Swiss-based DocMorris AG is a leading company in the fields of online pharmacy, marketplace and professional healthcare with strong brands in Germany and other European countries. With its business model, DocMorris offers its patients, customers and partners a broad range of products and services. In doing so, DocMorris is pursuing its vision of creating a digital health ecosystem for everyone to manage their health in one click.

In Spain and France, the company operates the leading marketplace for health and personal care products in Southern Europe. With an innovative business model, our marketplace does not manage stock or warehouses, it integrates the catalog of products, pricing, and stock levels of the most important and trusted off-line pharmacies in a single website, achieving 24h delivery service for more than 200.000 products and 10.000 brands from more than 1.000 pharmacies and health stores. Our business model and service have received several awards like the prize for Best Webshop in Spain as well as the Best Mobile App from the E-Commerce Awards.

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Data team, reporting to the Head of Data and working side by side with the business, finance, marketing, and engineering teams, to help extract the full value from our data in order to ask and answer questions, make decisions, and optimize, all to improve the experience for our customers and marketplace sellers by helping our internal teams with the appropriate data and reports.

Tasks and Responsibilities:


Follow-up and analysis of the main KPIs related to marketing, business, operations and finance in order to detect deviations, propose improvement actions, facilitate the decision-making process, and to detect/prevent potential loss of business faster.
Continuous development of efficient/automated reporting dashboards, tools, and processes to support decision-making.
Assisting stakeholders in the usage of the various existing systems and datasets available within the company and driving the development of new solutions.
Ad-hoc analysis to assist different teams in the decision making process, such as evaluating the performance of A/B Tests.
Prepare the monthly presentations for Business review meetings and Boards.
Support CFO, CMO, Marketing managers and SEO manager in the process of preparing the annual Budget and Rolling forecast.
Collaborate with and support the different teams inside the company, serving as the link and translator between these stakeholders and the data team, managing, clarifying, and defining their requests.


What we are looking for:


Professional Experience:
Minimum 2 year experience as a Data Analyst.
Experience in a customer-centric company, preferably e-commerce, transactional marketplace, or e-health, is a plus.
People Skills:
Excellence: in organization, planning and execution. Focus on details and ability to work under pressure and prioritize. Experience with Agile is a plus.
Proactivity: proposes new ideas and is able to work independently.
Ownership: takes on every challenge with responsibility until we find the solution. Problem solving mind-set.
Team: accustomed to collaborating with many stakeholders from multiple departments, solving problems together and sharing in achievements, failures, successes.
Highly analytical skills: obsession with data and continuous improvement.
Professional Skills:
Proficiency in the use of Excel.
Experience using a BI tool. Qlik Sense is a plus.
Good command of SQL.
Knowledge of Python or similar programming language.
Languages: Spanish and English (proficiency).
Domain knowledge (marketing, business, finance, operations, logistics) is a plus.


Our Benefits


Ticket restaurant 11‚Ç¨/day worked
25 days of holiday
Birthday day-off + 50‚Ç¨ voucher to spend on our website!
Health insurance with Sanitas is paid by PromoFarma (for those who want it!)
Social benefits package. You can dedicate a part of your gross salary to Ticket Transport or Nursery.
Opportunity to participate in the employee participation program (stock options)
10% discount on our website on each purchase and up to 30% discount on DocMorris branded products
Access to eLearning platforms such as LinkedIn Learning
Individual training opportunities and budget for personal development
Access to corporate wellness plattform "Wellhub" (ex Gympass) with various offers on gyms, studios, guided classes, workouts and wellness app
Access to mobile consultations with medical specialists, lawyers or veterinarians via "Doctor i "
Great employee events and annual company celebrations

Title: Data Analyst (Based in Spain only)
Description:
Imagine yourself‚Ä¶


Growing your expertise and expanding your skillset with every project.
Owning your ambition and fueling your career growth.
Joining a company with a proven track record of success and an exciting future.



It‚Äôs all possible with a role at Esko. Esko, a Veralto company, is a global provider of integrated software and hardware solutions that accelerate the go-to-market process of packaged goods. Our integrated platform and comprehensive tools empower retailers, pre-media and trade shops, manufacturers, and converters to manage best-in-class packaging design and print processes.

Innovation in the is built into the DNA of our business: every day, we challenge ourselves to be better by seeking out new ways to elevate our products, our processes, and our people.

We also know that innovation and ingenuity starts with prioritizing a diverse workforce and a deeply inclusive workplace. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our‚ÄØpositions.‚ÄØ

As a Data Analyst, you‚Äôll work on a variety of customer-focused data projects, driving impactful insights and solutions. This is a remote position based in Spain. Candidates based in other countries will not be considered.

In this role, a typical day will look like:


Connecting data sources ‚Äì Establish and manage reliable connections to a variety of internal and external data sources, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
Transforming and preparing data ‚Äì Use SQL, Power Query, and other tools to clean, blend, and structure data for reporting and analysis.
Designing dashboards & reports ‚Äì Build intuitive, visually compelling dashboards in Power‚ÄØBI that surface key metrics and performance trends for a wide range of stakeholders.
Analyzing trends & patterns ‚Äì Drill into datasets to uncover drivers, anomalies, and opportunities that inform strategic and operational decisions.
Presenting insights ‚Äì Communicate complex findings to both technical and non‚Äëtechnical audiences through presentations, reports, and live demo sessions.
Partnering with the business ‚Äì Collaborate closely with product, operations, and commercial teams to translate business questions into analytic deliverables.
Occasional travel within Spain and across Europe to participate in workshops and meetings, fostering collaboration and aligning data initiatives with broader company goals.



The essential requirements of the job include:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Business, Economics, Data Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field.
:1 year of experience (including internships) in a Data Analyst or similar role, working with real‚Äëworld datasets.
Strong SQL skills for querying and manipulating relational databases.
Hands‚Äëon Power‚ÄØBI experience creating interactive dashboards, reports, and data models.
Experience with DAX and Power Query) to build effective analytical solutions.
Foundational statistical knowledge (e.g., distributions, hypothesis testing) and an analytical mindset.
Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to explain data insights clearly.



It would be great if you have:


Proficiency with Python (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib) for data manipulation and visualization.
Exposure to cloud data platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP) and version control (Git).
Knowledge of data storytelling and visualization best practices.



Esko is proud to part of the Product Quality & Innovation segment of Veralto (NYSE: VLTO), a $5B global leader dedicated to ensuring access to clean water, safe food and medicine, and trusted essential goods. When you join Veralto‚Äôs vibrant global network of 16,000 associates, you join a unique culture and work environment where purpose meets possibility: where the work you do has an everyday impact on the resources and essentials we all rely on, and where you‚Äôll have valuable opportunities to deepen your skillset, pursue your ambitions, and grow your career. Together, we‚Äôre Safeguarding the World‚Äôs Most Vital Resources‚Ñ¢‚Äîand building rewarding careers along the way.

At Veralto, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

If you‚Äôve ever wondered what‚Äôs within you, there‚Äôs no better time to find out.

Unsolicited Assistance

We do not accept unsolicited assistance from any headhunters or recruitment firms for any of our job openings. All resumes or profiles submitted by search firms to any employee at any of the Veralto companies, in any form without a valid, signed search agreement in place for the specific position, approved by Talent Acquisition, will be deemed the sole property of Veralto and its companies. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Veralto and its companies because of the unsolicited referral.

, Gabriela Monfrecola, >
