It‚Äôs all possible with a role at Esko. Esko, a Veralto company, is a global provider of integrated software and hardware solutions that accelerate the go-to-market process of packaged goods. Our integrated platform and comprehensive tools empower retailers, pre-media and trade shops, manufacturers, and converters to manage best-in-class packaging design and print processes.

Innovation in the is built into the DNA of our business: every day, we challenge ourselves to be better by seeking out new ways to elevate our products, our processes, and our people.

We also know that innovation and ingenuity starts with prioritizing a diverse workforce and a deeply inclusive workplace. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our‚ÄØpositions.‚ÄØ

As a Data Analyst, you‚Äôll work on a variety of customer-focused data projects, driving impactful insights and solutions. This is a remote position based in Spain. Candidates based in other countries will not be considered.

In this role, a typical day will look like:

  • Connecting data sources ‚Äì Establish and manage reliable connections to a variety of internal and external data sources, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
  • Transforming and preparing data ‚Äì Use SQL, Power Query, and other tools to clean, blend, and structure data for reporting and analysis.
  • Designing dashboards & reports ‚Äì Build intuitive, visually compelling dashboards in Power‚ÄØBI that surface key metrics and performance trends for a wide range of stakeholders.
  • Analyzing trends & patterns ‚Äì Drill into datasets to uncover drivers, anomalies, and opportunities that inform strategic and operational decisions.
  • Presenting insights ‚Äì Communicate complex findings to both technical and non‚Äëtechnical audiences through presentations, reports, and live demo sessions.
  • Partnering with the business ‚Äì Collaborate closely with product, operations, and commercial teams to translate business questions into analytic deliverables.
  • Occasional travel within Spain and across Europe to participate in workshops and meetings, fostering collaboration and aligning data initiatives with broader company goals.


The essential requirements of the job include:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Business, Economics, Data Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field.
  • :1 year of experience (including internships) in a Data Analyst or similar role, working with real‚Äëworld datasets.
  • Strong SQL skills for querying and manipulating relational databases.
  • Hands‚Äëon Power‚ÄØBI experience creating interactive dashboards, reports, and data models.
  • Experience with DAX and Power Query) to build effective analytical solutions.
  • Foundational statistical knowledge (e.g., distributions, hypothesis testing) and an analytical mindset.
  • Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to explain data insights clearly.


It would be great if you have:

  • Proficiency with Python (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib) for data manipulation and visualization.
  • Exposure to cloud data platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP) and version control (Git).
  • Knowledge of data storytelling and visualization best practices.


Esko is proud to part of the Product Quality & Innovation segment of Veralto (NYSE: VLTO), a $5B global leader dedicated to ensuring access to clean water, safe food and medicine, and trusted essential goods. When you join Veralto‚Äôs vibrant global network of 16,000 associates, you join a unique culture and work environment where purpose meets possibility: where the work you do has an everyday impact on the resources and essentials we all rely on, and where you‚Äôll have valuable opportunities to deepen your skillset, pursue your ambitions, and grow your career. Together, we‚Äôre Safeguarding the World‚Äôs Most Vital Resources‚Ñ¢‚Äîand building rewarding careers along the way.

At Veralto, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

If you‚Äôve ever wondered what‚Äôs within you, there‚Äôs no better time to find out.

Unsolicited Assistance

We do not accept unsolicited assistance from any headhunters or recruitment firms for any of our job openings. All resumes or profiles submitted by search firms to any employee at any of the Veralto companies, in any form without a valid, signed search agreement in place for the specific position, approved by Talent Acquisition, will be deemed the sole property of Veralto and its companies. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Veralto and its companies because of the unsolicited referral.

, Gabriela Monfrecola, >

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We power people‚Äôs progress.

At Preply, we‚Äôre all about creating life-changing learning experiences. We help people discover the magic of the perfect tutor, craft a personalized learning journey, and stay motivated to keep growing. Our approach is human-led, tech-enabled - and it‚Äôs creating real impact. So far, 90,000 tutors have delivered over 20 million lessons to learners in more than 175 countries. Every Preply lesson sparks change, fuels ambition, and drives progress that matters.

Meet The Team

At Preply, we‚Äôre reimagining the way we support language learning!

Our B2B team is at the forefront of enabling global companies to unlock language skills across their workforces. As our B2B offering continues to grow, we‚Äôre looking for a Junior Data Analyst - Insights to join our team and support our data driven decision-making.

You‚Äôll be part of the Data chapter and embedded in the B2B squad, working alongside a senior data scientist, analytical engineer, and analytics manager. The role is ideal for someone who already has an analytical foundation and is eager to learn, grow, and make an impact in a dynamic and varied business environment.

We have an outstanding data science organization: we work throughout the company - in the product, business, and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, data visualisation, and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Preply.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Discover insights and inform the B2B team by running queries and extracting data using SQL and spreadsheets
Help build, improve and maintain data visualisations and reports to track B2B performance
Collaborate with the team on analyses related to customer success, product usage, and sales goals
Gain a deep understanding of B2B business metrics and use data to identify patterns or areas for improvement
Partner with your manager and peers to build skills and grow your analytical toolkit
Measure the impact of initiatives in order to identify growth opportunities and iterate our strategy
Create reporting that the team can use to evaluate and track business performance and take action upon


What You Need To Succeed


Some experience in the data science & analytics field (around 1-2 years' experience or internships preferably)
Strong working knowledge of SQL for querying and data exploration
Comfortable with spreadsheets (Google Sheets or Excel), including functions, charts, and pivot tables
Some experience with data visualisation (can be in any tool)
Some knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.)
Some coding skills in one or more analytics languages (Python, SQL, etc.)
Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem finding skills, and interest in learning about business context and impact
Good written and verbal communication skills - B1 English is a must


Nice To Have


University degree in statistics, economics, econometrics, or a relevant field (or equivalent business experience).
Experience working in startups, tech, or digital B2B environments
Previous experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C)
Basic knowledge of business metrics like retention, conversion, or usage patterns
Knowledge of Looker, Tableau, Amplitude or other BI tools;
Knowledge of version controlling tools (GitHub, GitLab, etc.).


Why You‚Äôll Love It At Preply


An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;
A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;
Access to free mental health support platforms;
Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;
The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).


Our Principles


Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don‚Äôt fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

Title: Data Analyst, Solutions & Innovation
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a member of our Analytics Solutions & Innovation (AXSI) team, you will act as a key analytical partner to our commercial organization, helping to steer innovation from the ground up. Your role will be crucial in developing new ways to measure and demonstrate value for our clients.


Solution Prototyping & Development: Translate complex business questions into scalable data analyses, prototyping new measurement methodologies for Criteo‚Äôs latest upper-funnel solutions using our rich shopper graph dataset.
Client & Internal Collaboration: Collaborate with internal teams and clients to deeply understand their business needs and how they measure the value of upper-funnel marketing activities.
Iterative Analysis & Validation: Design and execute analyses to validate new measurement approaches, iterating on prototypes with internal partners to refine them for production readiness.
Product Innovation & Scalability: Partner with Product and R&D teams to develop feature requests, transforming your successful analytical prototypes into scalable, fully-fledged Criteo products.
Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Git, Python, and SQL to build innovative analytical solutions from the ground up.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with commercial and product teams to deliver insights that drive the development of new, revenue-generating solutions.



Who You Are:


You have at least 1 year of hands-on data analysis experience, with proficiency in SQL and Python.
A natural problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Business-minded with a talent for turning data insights into actionable product strategies.
Passionate about product development and turning analytical prototypes into real-world solutions.
Excellent ability to synthesize complex information and present clear, actionable recommendations.
A team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.
Eligible to work in Spain with no restrictions.



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform. üåü

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Workplace Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

Are you passionate about data analysis and want to contribute to enhancing user experience at Allianz? Join our team as a Senior Data Analyst in the Workplace Service department, where you will play a key role in transforming data into valuable insights that guide our decisions. If you have experience in data analytics and are looking for a collaborative environment, we want to meet you

What You Do


Transform & enrich data from various data sources to draw a holistic view of service health, possible issues & weak points.
Using statistical libraries and programming to identify, analyse, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets.
Respond to data-related queries from other WPS product teams & implement them jointly.
Analyze data and visualize results using Power BI and similar technologies.
Research new ways to make use of the collected data (e.g., apply AI for pattern recognition).
Produce reports and charts communicating trends within data to non-specialists..
Support product teams for the root cause & impact analysis during incident and problem management process.
Ideate data analytics requirements together with other WPS teams with various maturity in the data analytics area.


What You Bring


At least 3 years of practical experience within data analytics with hands on experience with python.
Good understanding of modern software design and development technologies, such as data lake, containers, DevOps and knowledge of cloud services such as Azure, AWS or similar.
Strong analytical skills with ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Technical expertise, previous experience working with data models, data mining, prediction models, and segmentation techniques.
Strong knowledge of and experience with data storage (SQL, cloud storage etc), programming (python, SQL, PySpark etc.) and BI tools (Power BI etc.).
Strong knowledge of statistics and applying statistical packages for analysing datasets.
Good interpersonal and collaboration skills as well as ability to jointly work with multiple groups.
Hands on experience in creating and deploying analytical dashboard solutions including understanding of design, development, deployment, data engineering and data management practices.
Higher education degree in IT, business intelligence, or comparable education.


What We Offer


We offer a hybrid work model which recognizes the value of striking a balance between in-person collaboration and remote working incl. up to 25 days per year working from abroad.
We believe in rewarding performance and our compensation and benefits package includes a company bonus scheme, pension, employee shares program and multiple employee discounts (details vary by location).
From career development and digital learning programs to international career mobility, we offer lifelong learning for our employees worldwide and an environment where innovation, delivery and empowerment are fostered.
Flexible working, health and wellbeing offers (including healthcare and parental leave benefits) support to balance family and career and help our people return from career breaks with experience that nothing else can teach.


About Allianz Technology

With its headquarters in Munich, Germany, Allianz Technology is Allianz's global IT service provider and delivers IT solutions that drive the group's digitalization. With more than 11,000 employees in over 20 countries around the world, Allianz Technology is tasked to run, optimize, transform, and innovate the infrastructure, applications, and services together with Allianz companies to co-create the best customer experience.

We service the entire spectrum of digitalization ‚Äì from one of the industry's largest IT infrastructure projects that spans data centres, networks, and security, to application platforms ranging from workplace services to digital interaction.

In short: We deliver comprehensive end-to-end IT solutions for Allianz in the digital age. We are the backbone of Allianz.

Find us at: www.linkedin.com/company/allianz-technology.

D&I statement

Allianz Technology is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity and commits itself to creating an inclusive work environment for all.

We therefore welcome applications regardless of race, ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, social class, disability or sexual orientation, or any other characteristics protected under applicable local laws and regulations.

Join us. Let¬¥s care for tomorrow.

You. IT.

To Recruitment Agencies:

Allianz Technology has an in-house recruitment team that sources great candidates directly. Therefore, Allianz Technology does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies or search firm recruiters.

When we do work with recruitment agencies, that engagement is formalized by a contract. Fees will only be paid when there is a contract in place. Without a contract in place, we will not accept invoices on unsolicited resumes, even if the candidate was ultimately employed by Allianz

Title: Climate Data Analyst - all genders
Description:
Opella is the self-care challenger with the purest and third-largest portfolio in the Over-The-Counter (OTC) & Vitamins, Minerals & Supplements (VMS) market globally. ‚ÄØ

Our mission is to bring health in people‚Äôs hands by making self-care as simple as it should be. For half a billion consumers worldwide ‚Äì and counting.

At the core of this mission is our 100 loved brands, our 11,000-strong global team, our 13 best-in-class manufacturing sites and 4 specialized science and innovation development centers. Headquartered in France, Opella is the proud maker of many of the world‚Äôs most loved brands, including Allegra, Buscopan, Doliprane, Dulcolax, Enterogermina, Essentiale and Mucosolvan.

B Corp certified in multiple markets, we are active players in the journey towards healthier people and planet. Find out more about our mission at www.opella.com.

About The Job

Opella's promise is to challenge the conventions of care and define a whole new way to think about health ‚Äì for our people, our communities, and our planet. And we mean our words: Opella is BCorp certified and our Net Zero Target has been submitted to the Science Base Target initiative for approval.

In that context of our net zero transformation, we are looking for a Climate Data Analyst who will play a pivotal role in developing new Data analytics and Data Science techniques to inform decision-making and fuel our Decarbonization roadmap.

In this position, you will report to our NetZero Transformation lead.

The position is based in Barcelona (Spain).

Key Responsibilities

1/ Ensure Carbon data are collected, actionable, governed, scalable and integrated throughout the organization:


Design pragmatic solutions to improve calculation methods from primary systems and develop automated data collection processes and pipelines to ensure timely and accurate acquisition of data, utilizing APIs and database connections.
Collaborate with IT and data engineering teams to design and optimize data architectures, storage solutions, and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes for efficient data management and access.
Implement data stewardship and governance to maintain data integrity, consistency, and reliability across various data sources.
Establish a centralized data repository to serve as the single source of truth for carbone data within the organization.


2/ Provide Cross Functional Teams (Science Hub, Manufacturing And Supply, Procurement, Brands) With The Relevant Data Support To Help Them To Articulate Their Decarbonization Road Map


Develop and maintain data visualisation (dashboards, reports, and performance metrics) to track key Decarbonization indicators.
Conduct scenario analysis and predictive modeling to assess the potential decarbonation opportunities and identify opportunities for operational efficiencies, cost savings, and revenue generation through carbon-related initiatives.
Provide training and support to internal stakeholders on data access, data visualization tools, and best practices for utilizing the centralized data repository effectively.


3/ Develop our Net Zero Digital transformation roadmap

Qualifications


Master‚Äôs degree in Data science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
5-7 years of experience in similar data management role
Statistical modeling / data analysis experience in R, Python, SAS or similar tools
Strong SQL command and the ability to write complex queries on big data sets
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Familiarity with machine learning and predictive analytics.
Extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources including web APIs, databases and flat files.
Data Experience applied in a Scope 3 / Product Carbon foot-printing context is a strong plus.
Ability to convey complex data insights clearly
Analytical problem-solving capabilities & experience
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work cross-functionally and communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


Why us?

At Opella, you will enjoy doing challenging, purposeful work, empowered to develop consumer brands with passion and creativity. This is your chance to grow new skills and be part of a bold, collaborative, and inclusive culture where people can thrive and be at their best every day.

We Are Challengers.

We Are Dedicated To Making Self-care As Simple As It Should Be. That Starts With Our Culture. We Are Challengers By Nature, And This Is How We Do Things

All In Together: We keep each other honest and have each other's backs.

Courageous: We break boundaries and take thoughtful risks with creativity.

Outcome-Obsessed: We are personally accountable, driving sustainable impact and results with integrity.

Radically Simple: We strive to make things simple for us and simple for consumers, as it should be.

Join us on our mission. Health. In your hands.

www.opella.com/en/careers

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech‚Äôs invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton‚Äôs services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here!

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented data analyst to help us support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will be embedded within a business unit (Mail, VPN, Drive, Growth, etc) and will play a key role in understanding our customers, guiding the team in their decision-making, and driving the implementation of new features and growth initiatives. As part of the data team, you will also collaborate with data science and data engineering in improving our data platform.

What You Will Do



Lead colleagues to the right decision by using data
Assemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets from different data sources
Apply tools and techniques for data analysis and visualization
Represent and summarize data and findings in the most appropriate format
Research new use cases for already existing data, and provide feedback on new data sources to be incorporated
Share findings and best practices for your business unit with analysts in other business units



Job Requirements



Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitive (statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc) or financial discipline.
Strong analytical skills
Experience in business intelligence, product analytics, marketing KPIs, or web analytics
at least 5 years of relevant working experience in the field
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Strong data visualization skills



Bonus points for:



Good knowledge of Python
Git knowledge
Open-minded, ready to test and implement new ideas



What We Offer



Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton‚Äôs only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.



Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.


Show more
HTML:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech‚Äôs invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton‚Äôs services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here!

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented data analyst to help us support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will be embedded within a business unit (Mail, VPN, Drive, Growth, etc) and will play a key role in understanding our customers, guiding the team in their decision-making, and driving the implementation of new features and growth initiatives. As part of the data team, you will also collaborate with data science and data engineering in improving our data platform.

What You Will Do


  • Lead colleagues to the right decision by using data
  • Assemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets from different data sources
  • Apply tools and techniques for data analysis and visualization
  • Represent and summarize data and findings in the most appropriate format
  • Research new use cases for already existing data, and provide feedback on new data sources to be incorporated
  • Share findings and best practices for your business unit with analysts in other business units


Job Requirements


  • Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitive (statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc) or financial discipline.
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Experience in business intelligence, product analytics, marketing KPIs, or web analytics
  • at least 5 years of relevant working experience in the field
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL
  • Strong data visualization skills


Bonus points for:


  • Good knowledge of Python
  • Git knowledge
  • Open-minded, ready to test and implement new ideas


What We Offer


  • Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
  • Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
  • Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
  • Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
  • Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
  • Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
  • Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
  • Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
  • Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton‚Äôs only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.


Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your Role

We are looking for a detail-oriented and motivated Data Analyst with at least 5 years experience to support our analytics initiatives and contribute to the delivery of data products that drive business growth.

This role will involve working closely with various business areas, including Market Analysis, Media, Promotions, CRM, and Digital Products.

As Data Analyst you‚Äôll be responsible for preparing, analyzing, and visualizing data to uncover actionable insights.

This is a great opportunity to grow in a data-driven organization while working with cutting-edge tools and gaining exposure to real-world business challenges.

What you will do


Data Preparation & Analysis:
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Support the development of reports, dashboards, and visualizations to present insights to internal stakeholders.
Ensure data quality by conducting regular audits and identifying inconsistencies or gaps.
Contribute to projects that require integrating data from different sources, including Google Cloud Platform ( BigQuery , Looker) and SAP analytics tools ( DataSphere , SAC).
Business Support :
Collaborate with teams across Marketing, Sales, and Digital to understand their data needs and provide relevant analysis.
Translate business questions into data queries and actionable insights.
Present findings in a clear and concise manner, tailoring communication to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Focus on Market, Media, and Promotions Analytics:
Support analysis of market trends, media performance, and promotional effectiveness.
Assist in calculating ROI, customer segmentation, and channel performance evaluations.
Help build and maintain dashboards that track key metrics for media, promotions, and market dynamics.
Continuous Learning & Improvement :
Stay updated on best practices in data analytics, visualization, and storytelling.
Learn and apply emerging tools and techniques, such as machine learning models or advanced statistical methods, as directed by the Senior Data Analyst.
Contribute ideas to improve existing processes, tools, and methodologies.



What we are looking for

Technical Expertise


Proficiency in data analytics tools such as Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Looker) and literacy in SAP analytics tools (DataSphere, SAC).
Experience with data visualization platforms like Power BI or Looker.
Understanding of statistical analysis and machine learning concepts.



Collaboration & Communication


Strong interpersonal skills to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams
Focus on a continuous value-delivery with an agile approach.
Ability to communicate technical findings in a clear, business-friendly manner.
Eagerness to learn from senior team members and contribute to team success.



What we offer


Hybrid working model
Flexible working hours
Ticket Restaurants
Pension plan
Fully equipped Gym
Breakfast and fresh fruit
Affinity University platform: Professional development opportunities for employees at different stages of their careers, acknowledging diverse career paths.
Pet-friendly office
Celebrations & Fun



If you don‚Äôt m eet all the requirements, don‚Äôt worry. We value diverse backgrounds and encourage you to apply anyway. Your application will be thoughtfully reviewed!

We cultivate an inclusive culture that celebrates diversity. We firmly believe that embracing a variety o f perspectives is integral to both our company‚Äôs success and the strength of our team. That‚Äôs why we are committed to providing equal opportunities for all.

Our Company

Affinity Petcare is more than an international petfood company. For more than 60 years , we have been dedicated to nourishing healthy bonds between dogs, cats, and people to make the world a better place.

We are very proud of our innovative brands which include: Ultima, Advance, Brekkies, Nature‚Äôs Variety, Nature‚Äôs Menu, Natural Trainer, Li bra, and more. Currently, we have over 1,200 professionals working for this purpose from Barcelona, Paris, Milan, and London, as well as 4 production sites through which we supply the 70+ countries where our brands have a presence.

So, what are you waiti ng for? Join our team to leave your footprint!

Want to know more about us?

Follow us on LinkedIn for the latest updates and job opportunities. You can also follow us on Instagram to learn more about life at Affinity and hear from our team.

Title: Digital Data Analyst
Description:
Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade ‚Äì this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We‚Äôre focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

Job Description

Lleva tu carrera al siguiente nivel con Amaris Consulting como Data Analyst en Barcelona. Convi√©rtete en parte de un equipo internacional, prospera en un grupo global con una facturaci√≥n de 800 millones de euros y m√°s de 1,000 clientes en todo el mundo, y trabaja en un entorno √°gil planificando el inicio y el seguimiento de proyectos.

El candidato ideal tiene una amplia experiencia en Python, R, SQL, Snowflake, BigQuery, Google Analytics 4, Google Tag Manager, y herramientas de Data Visualization como Power BI, Looker o Tableau. Adem√°s, est√° familiarizado con la orquestaci√≥n de datos (Airflow o similar), control de versiones (Git), y est√° ubicado en Barcelona o alrededores. Se valorar√° positivamente contar con veh√≠culo propio y disponibilidad para trabajar bajo un modelo h√≠brido.

√önete a Amaris Consulting, donde podr√°s desarrollar tu potencial y marcar la diferencia dentro de la emrpesa.

‚úçÔ∏è¬øQU√â NECESITAR√çAS?‚úçÔ∏è



Habilidades avanzadas en Python y R para desarrollo de procesos ETL, an√°lisis de datos y automatizaci√≥n.
Dominio de SQL para manipulaci√≥n, transformaci√≥n y extracci√≥n eficiente de datos.
Experiencia con Cloud Data Warehouses como Snowflake, BigQuery, o Redshift.
Conocimiento en Google Analytics 4 y Google Tag Manager para el seguimiento del comportamiento de usuarios y optimizaci√≥n web.
Capacidad para crear dashboards e informes interactivos con Power BI, Looker o Tableau.
Experiencia en orquestaci√≥n de datos con Airflow o herramientas similares.
Uso de Git para gesti√≥n y seguimiento de c√≥digo.
Capacidad para trabajar en un entorno √°gil y colaborativo.

Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade ‚Äì this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We‚Äôre focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

Job Description

Title: IT Data Analyst
Description:
Techsoulogy is our way of doing things and our corporate brand that unifies a broad portfolio of specialist advertising, media, and entertainment firms. It combines the latest technology with a human-first approach and a constant exploration of knowledge in order to shape the media landscape.

At Techsoulogy we aim to provide a technology and human service that guarantee all areas of the advertising industry throughout the world achieving their goals profitably, effectively and ethically.

Our values drive our culture, which is the most important asset of our company.


We're fair
We're dedicated
We're honest
We're courageous
We're Team lovers


TAPPX with Techsoulogy

Tappx is a fast-growth AdTech company inside the Techsoulogy family. It delivers digital advertising solutions for multiple platforms including mobile, OTT/CTV and desktop.

Tappx‚Äô proprietary technology empowers publishers to maximize ad revenues across mobile and OTT channels. It offers a distinct point of difference, technology which has been specifically engineered for mobile and OTT markets, thereby offering brands and agencies increased trust and transparency.

Tappx has headlined across numerous high profile competitive growth rankings such as Red Herring in 2016, TECH5 in 2018 and in 2020 Tappx was featured as Europe‚Äôs 2nd fastest growing advertising company in The Financial Times FT1000.

In Tappx we keep growing and, therefore, we are looking for new talented people to join our Data team in our IT department.

As a Data Analyst you will:


Analyze complex datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports in Power BI, Data Studio, and Looker Studio.
Create clear and compelling data visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Ensure visualizations are tailored to meet the specific needs of different audiences.
Extract, clean, and preprocess data from various sources to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Work closely with business units to understand their data needs and provide relevant insights.
Translate business requirements into technical specifications for data projects.
Track and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of initiatives.
Ensure reports are accurate, consistent, and delivered on time.
Stay updated with the latest tools and technologies in data analysis and visualization.
Perform statistical analyses to validate hypotheses and support business case development.
Use statistical methods to quantify the impact of various strategies and initiatives.


Your Dream Job Awaits at Techsoulogy! üöÄ

Indefinite Contract with Competitive Conditions

Flexible Working Hours (Take Control of Your Schedule) with core time

Hybrid Model in Barcelona (1 day in the office and the rest teleworking) or 100% Remote Work Anywhere in Spain

Cool HQ Offices in Barcelona and Co-Working in Madrid

Elevate Your Work Experience with Techsoulogy! üåü

Private Health Insurance

Mental Health Care with 20 Free Hours of Psychologist Support

1&1 English or Spanish Language Lessons

Continuous Training & Development Budget

Healthy Snacks, Coffee and (a lot of) Tea (HQ)

Fun-Filled Arcade Room (HQ)

Team Building Activities

Inspiring Internal Talks and Events

Interesting Employee Referral Program

Engage in Techsoulogy‚Äôs CSR Initiatives

Flexible Compensation for Transport, Meals, and Kindergartens

Ready to shape your future? Join us! üöÄ

#Techsoulogy #CareerPerks #JoinUsNow #WorkPerks #CareerGrowth

Requirements:

We are looking for if you have:


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering and Science programs, Economics, or a related field
3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst in programming languages such as Python, PySpark and experience with data manipulation tools like SQL.
3+ years of experience in data analysis and reporting.
Experience integrating data from a variety of sources.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Experience in HTML and CSS is a plus.


Desirable:


Good at understanding data and extracting insights from it.
Pattern detection.
Fast learner, absorbs new domains quickly.
Proactivity.
Analytical mind.
Problem-solving aptitude.
Knowledge of Python, SQL and GCP.
Curiosity driven.
High level of Spanish
Result oriented

Title: Advanced Analytics Analyst
Description:
About The Job

Sanofi has recently embarked into a vast and ambitious digital transformation program. A cornerstone of this roadmap is the acceleration of its data transformation and of the adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) solutions, to accelerate R&D, manufacturing and commercial performance and bring better drugs and vaccines to patients faster, to improve health and save lives.

We are looking for a dynamic Advanced Analytics Analyst interested in challenging the status quo on deploying enterprise data products, with AI models and underlying data visualizations for data consumption. You are a valued influencer and a thought leader who is motivated to contribute to an AI focused Digital data organization. You have a keen eye for improvement opportunities and the demonstrated ability to deliver solutions that would enable data visualization, analytics, and data sciences.

Main Responsibilities


As a data champion, look to implement analytical models on data sets to uncover insights
Validate business requirements, defining global standards for data models, key performance indicators and measures, then implementing the global standards within our products for business units and markets
Create and implement repeatable analytics models in order to assess to measure performance or assess quality of data
Tell a story with data, hosting co-creation sessions to ensure needs are well understood and features are well articulated, producing mock-ups as required to quickly iterate on user feedback
Understand the data landscape that enables the enterprise solutions, with the ability to align on global standards across multiple stakeholder groups
A critical and analytical thinker, and a creative problem solver who can navigate difficult discussions and ambiguity to arrive at design solutions
Understand and implement enterprise data governance, data architecture and data management standards
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand the business requirements, translating them to data, analytics and AI capabilities
Partner with Product Owners and Scrum Masters and be able to work in agile pods
Partner with Data Engineers and Data scientists to create data products


About You

Key Functional Requirements & Qualifications:


Strong knowledge working within an Agile environment
Strong knowledge and experience deploying analytical models using software development tools like GitHub
Experience in data visualization and analytics solutions deployment
Experience in building data pipelines with data quality metrics in place
Interest and/or experience in healthcare and pharmaceutical data


Key Technical Requirements & Qualifications


A university / college degree graduate in disciplines of engineering, computer science, mathematics, data science or related fields
Strong technical knowledge coupled with extensive experience in building analytical models, using scripting languages like python, and querying languages like SQL
Knowledge and experience of data platform tools like Snowflake and cloud platforms like AWS
Knowledge in UX and UI design and visualization tools like PowerBI and Tableau


Why choose us?


An international work environment, in which you can develop your talent and realize ideas and innovations within a competent team
An environment based on last technologies and frequent training to reinforce your profile
Flexible home office policy, with a possibility to work up to 60% of time from home / where you can easily schedule your office days
Work from an "Office of the Year 2024" finalist office


Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Progress doesn‚Äôt happen without people ‚Äì people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. You can be one of those people. Chasing change, embracing new ideas and exploring all the opportunities we have to offer. Let‚Äôs pursue progress. And let‚Äôs discover extraordinary together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!

#BarcelonaHub #SanofiHubs

nullPursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Join Sanofi and step into a new era of science - where your growth can be just as transformative as the work we do. We invest in you to reach further, think faster, and do what‚Äôs never-been-done-before. You‚Äôll help push boundaries, challenge convention, and build smarter solutions that reach the communities we serve. Ready to chase the miracles of science and improve people‚Äôs lives? Let‚Äôs Pursue Progress and Discover Extraordinary ‚Äì together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Key Functional Requirements & Qualifications:

  • Strong knowledge working within an Agile environment
  • Strong knowledge and experience deploying analytical models using software development tools like GitHub
  • Experience in data visualization and analytics solutions deployment
  • Experience in building data pipelines with data quality metrics in place
  • Interest and/or experience in healthcare and pharmaceutical data

Key Technical Requirements & Qualifications

  • A university / college degree graduate in disciplines of engineering, computer science, mathematics, data science or related fields
  • Strong technical knowledge coupled with extensive experience in building analytical models, using scripting languages like python, and querying languages like SQL
  • Knowledge and experience of data platform tools like Snowflake and cloud platforms like AWS
  • Knowledge in UX and UI design and visualization tools like PowerBI and Tableau

Why choose us?

  • An international work environment, in which you can develop your talent and realize ideas and innovations within a competent team
  • An environment based on last technologies and frequent training to reinforce your profile
  • Flexible home office policy, with a possibility to work up to 60% of time from home / where you can easily schedule your office days
  • Work from an "Office of the Year 2024" finalist office

Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Progress doesn‚Äôt happen without people ‚Äì people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. You can be one of those people. Chasing change, embracing new ideas and exploring all the opportunities we have to offer. Let‚Äôs pursue progress. And let‚Äôs discover extraordinary together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!

We invest in you to reach further, think faster, and do what‚Äôs never-been-done-before. You‚Äôll help push boundaries, challenge convention, and build smarter solutions that reach the communities we serve. Ready to chase the miracles of science and improve people‚Äôs lives? Title: Networks Data Analyst F/M
Description:
What You‚Äôll Be Doing

At Axa Partners, we are looking for our next Networks Data Analyst to be part of our data transformation journey and be part of the Motor Networks Cost Control department.

Data is a key part of AXA‚Äôs journey ‚Äúfrom Payer to Partner‚Äù, and its transformation to a Data Driven company. To succeed in this journey, AXA Partners data strategy has been organised around 6 dimensions: Data Value, Data Usage, Data Protection & Quality, Data Platform, Data Governance and Data Culture.

The Networks Data Analyst is therefore a cornerstone of the data transformation journey and he/she has to assist in the maintenance and creation of new reporting and analysis for both existing, new clients and internal clients from the existing MI database, ensuring throughout all performed analysis of the reliability and the business sense of the data. Networks Data Analyst interprets data and turns it into information which can offer ways to ease and improve business decisions. Networks Data Analysts gather information from various sources and interpret patterns and trends. Once data has been gathered and interpreted, the Data Analyst will report back what has been found in a comprehensive study to the wider business/relevant colleagues.

The post-holder will work closely with the Networks team, the Data teams and other teams to understand and define the report requirements and produce timely reports in a high quality format that can lead to decision making and partner discussions.

How Would Your Day To Day Be With Us


Provide business analysis and solutions for reporting requirements
Follow-up of Networks KPI‚Äôs and deviations alerts
Provide quality assurance of imported data
Commissioning and decommissioning of data sets
Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines
Helping develop reports and analysis
Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources
Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements
Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization
Generating reports from single or multiple systems
Training end-users on new reports and dashboards
Develop adhoc reports and analysis




What You‚Äôll Bring

You could be perfect for this role if you have :


Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel and PowerPoint
Degree in either Finance, Insurance, IT or Economics
Databases structures, Data Warehouse concepts, SQL knowledge
Experience with any visualisation tool such as Powerpivot, Power BI
Quickly understands the business issues and data challenges of clients organisation and industry
Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms
Results orientated with good communication and interpersonal skills
Ability and willingness to take complex business requirements and progress them through analysis, development and final output
Clear analytical approach, with ability to manage financial data and statistics to deliver sophisticated outcomes
Excellent interpersonal and team-working skills with a helpful, flexible and solution-oriented approach
Able to maintain a calm and positive approach even under pressure or in conflicted situations


Desirable


Experience within Financial Services environment, Insurance specifically


To apply, click on the ‚Äòapply for this job‚Äô button, you‚Äôll then need to log in or create a profile to submit your CV. We‚Äôre proud to be an Equal Opportunities Employer and don‚Äôt discriminate against employees or potential employees based on protected characteristics.

Who We Are

We‚Äôre AXA Partners, experts at designing and delivering assistance solutions and specialised insurance, credit, and lifestyle protection - with and for our partners worldwide. What sets us apart? The expertise and passion of our 8,500+ people, and a strong network of over 55,000 professionals all over the world. Powered by them and our sector-leading technology, we continuously evolve, adapt and thrive - offering solutions and services that make sure we‚Äôre always at people‚Äôs side, no matter what. Helping others is our passion. Combining the best digital technology with our warm, human touch, we‚Äôre always looking at new ways to offer seamless and reassuring experiences when it really matters.

Join a company that helps protect the forests! At AXA Partners, we plant a tree for every new recruit (with a permanent contract)

Title: Senior Data Analyst I
Description:
About The Team

Within the Global Operations organisation, our mission is to build the best customer experience in the fintech industry by delivering an effortless journey to all our merchants. We are looking for a skilled and passionate Senior Data Analyst to join our talented Data & Insights Team.

As a Senior Data Analyst at SumUp, you will be responsible for pushing forward a data-driven culture within the Operations organisation. You will be the primary point of contact for the Customer Support teams, working alongside them to define KPIs for evaluating the efficiency of our Service Models as well as evaluating the productivity and quality of our support agents. You will work with other data analysts, analytics engineers and data scientists to leverage business knowledge into impactful insights and recommendations.

What You Do


Develop advanced dashboards to facilitate self-service analytics for the Customer Support and Operations Leadership teams.
Partner up with Operations Leadership to develop strategies based on data-driven insights and qualitative analysis, focusing on Agent Performance.
Visualise insights and interpret results to present findings to stakeholders across the organisation, providing actionable recommendations based on your analysis.
Help define and implement KPIs to measure the success of our Support Service Model and the productivity of our agents.
Leverage SQL and data modelling best practices to manage and transform high volumes of data into actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven strategies.


You‚Äôll be great for this position if you have:


5+ years of experience working as a Data Analyst, preferably with knowledge of customer support.
Proficiency in developing, optimising, and validating SQL queries and data models.
Hands-on experience developing advanced dashboards following industry best practices, preferably using Tableau.
The capacity to examine business requirements across various functional areas and translate them into KPIs, insights, data models and dashboards.
Effective communication and presentation skills to convey complex data findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Can lead work independently as well as play a key role in mentoring and guiding others in a team


Why you should join SumUp:


Opportunity to work with SumUppers globally on large-scale fintech products used by millions of businesses worldwide, from our Berlin office. This involves an office-first setup
Restaurant tickets (powered by Edenred)
Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion: Be part of a workplace that values and promotes diversity, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone's perspectives are respected and embraced
A dedicated annual L&D budget of ‚Ç¨2000 for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education
30 Days Sabbatical: Enjoy the unique opportunity to take a well-deserved break with our 30-day sabbatical benefit after completing 3 years of employment with SumUp
Referral Bonus: Earn additional rewards by referring talented individuals to join the SumUp team


About SumUp

We believe in the everyday hero.

Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we create powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their businesses. With a founder‚Äôs mentality and a 'team-first‚Äô attitude, our diverse teams across Europe, South America and the United States work together to ensure that the small business owners we partner with can be successful doing what they love.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

SumUp will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don‚Äôt tick every box, it‚Äôs ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

Title: Data Analyst - Supply Operations - ECA (They/He/She)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: Building the largest marketplace in your city, to give access to anything in minutes. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

We are looking for a person with a positive attitude, lots of gas, creativity to think out of the box and passion for the work you will develop.

THE JOURNEY


Track courier performance and KPIs by analyzing historical operational metrics with a focus on company targets.
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Propose (be an enthusiast), track and consolidate new ideas to improve the operations by being obsessed with Glovo's KPIs.
Conduct A/B tests, analyze the results of each project and be able to easily replicate them in the rest of the countries.
Actively collaborate with other analysts in Glovo and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a difference.
Build robust relationships with Data Analysts in the ECA region acting as a strategic and supportive link between the HQ and local markets.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Minimum 1 year of experience outside of an academic and internship setting in a quantitative analysis role within start-ups, consulting firms, or large companies, ideally in Tech or FMCG
Bachelor Degree in Economics, Engineering or any business or technological domain
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheets skills
Knowledge of visualisation tools like Tableau, Looker and/or PowerBI
Passion about analytics: you enjoy deep diving into problems to find the root cause
Ability to manage multiple tasks, prioritize workload, and handle a fast-paced environment
High motivation to contribute to a fast-growing startup
Ability to work both independently and within a team
Capability of executing tasks quickly while maintaining a high standard of quality
Great spoken and written English
An empathetic, inclusive and curious attitude


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
