HTML:
Who We Are

At VML, we are a beacon of innovation and growth in an ever-evolving world. Our heritage is built upon a century of combined expertise, where creativity meets technology, and diverse perspectives ignite inspiration. With the merger of VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, we have forged a new path as a growth partner that is part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology powerhouse.

Our global family now encompasses over 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 64 markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences. Our expertise spans the entire customer journey, offering deep insights in communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. We deliver end-to-end solutions that result in revolutionary work.

Who We're Looking For

We are seeking a talented and detail-oriented Data Analyst with up to 3 years of experience to join our growing team. This role is ideal for someone passionate about turning complex data into actionable insights that support strategic decision-making. You will thrive in collaborative environments, demonstrate analytical thinking, and communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. A strong interest in the energy sector and digital behavior analytics will be key to success in this role.

What You'll Do

  • Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources to support business decisions.
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and interactive reports using Power BI and Looker Studio.
  • Monitor and interpret digital behavior using Google Analytics 4 (GA4).
  • Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to support business strategies with data-driven insights.

Who You Are

  • A data-driven professional with a knack for transforming data into meaningful insights.
  • A collaborative team player with a keen analytical mindset.
  • Eager to grow and contribute to impactful projects in the energy industry.
  • Comfortable communicating complex ideas clearly to varied audiences.

What You'll Need

  • Up to 3 years of experience in data analytics.
  • Proficiency with GA4, Power BI, and Looker Studio (required).
  • Previous experience in the energy sector (required).
  • Familiarity with Google Tag Manager is a plus.
  • Fluency in English (written and spoken).
  • Spanish language skills are a strong plus.

Bonus Points If You Have

  • Experience working in international or multicultural environments.
  • A commitment to continuous learning and skill development.
  • An ability to connect data insights to broader business opportunities.

We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we‚Äôve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office an average of four days a week. If you require accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process.

Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we‚Äôre able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Essential Skills

  • At least 5 years' experience in a similar role;
  • Solid experience in writing SQL queries for data manipulation and performance optimization in databases (SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL);
  • Experience in developing data models;
  • Proficiency in creating interactive visualizations and dashboards (Power BI, DAX);
  • Good knowledge of English.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Noesis Is Looking For Candidates With The Following Profile

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Mathematics, Computer Science, Management Informatics or equivalent;
  • Minimum 2 years of professional experience mining data as a Data Analyst;
  • Good analytics skills, including mining, modelling logical and conceptual, evaluation and data visualization;
  • Strong Power BI, SQL or Excel skills, with aptitude for learning other analytics tools;
  • Dynamism, proactivity and ability to work in a team;
  • Customer oriented;
  • Fluency in English will be valued.

If you meet these conditions and would like to join an innovative organization that continuously invests in training its talents, send us your application.

Join us. Let's innovate together!

All our recruitment and selection processes are based on equal opportunities, valuing the competence and potential of each person and ensuring that no candidate is discriminated on the grounds of gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, religion or physical condition.

With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we‚Äôre able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Essential Skills

  • Skilled in data visualization tools such as Power BI and Looker Studio to create clear, actionable reports and dashboards
  • Experience in Text Mining techniques to extract insights from unstructured data
  • Expertise in the full ETL process, ensuring data is clean, structured, and ready for analysis and decision-making
  • Strong working knowledge of GA4, providing in-depth insights into user behavior and marketing performance

What Do I Need Before I Apply

The opportunity is remote but the candidate must already be living in PT.

Title: Product Data Analyst Trainee | Digital Channels
Description:
Country: Portugal

Location: Lisbon (Hybrid)

About Santander

Santander Bank is a leading global financial institution, dedicated to helping individuals

and businesses prosper. With a presence in over 10 countries, we provide a full range of

banking services, including personal, business, and corporate banking. At Santander,

we‚Äôre committed to innovation and continuously improving our digital offerings to meet

the evolving needs of our customers. Our fintech-driven approach emphasizes

leveraging cutting-edge technology to deliver seamless, secure, and personalized

financial experiences.

About The Role

We are looking for a data-driven Product Data Analyst Trainee to join our Digital

Channels team. This role focuses on leveraging data to inform and optimize product

decisions, ensuring our web and app platforms deliver outstanding customer

experiences. The ideal candidate will have basic knowledge of Google Analytics 4 (GA4)

and an analytical background, helping the team with product discovery, business case

development, A/B testing, and the continuous monitoring of key features through

dashboards and reporting tools.

Main Responsibilities


User interaction Analysis: Support in analyzing web and app usage data to uncover


trends, user behavior, and opportunities for product improvement.


Product Discovery Support: Collaborate with Product Managers during the


discovery phase by providing insights from data to identify customer needs and validate

opportunities.


Business Case Development: Contribute to the development of business cases by


providing data-driven insights and projections to evaluate potential product initiatives.


Success Metrics Definition: Partner with stakeholders to define and track key


success metrics for new features and initiatives. Map and define tracking events for key

product metrics (GA4 tagging).


A/B Testing: Design, execute, and analyze A/B tests to validate hypotheses, measure


impact, and optimize product performance.


Dashboard Creation: Help to develop and maintain dashboards for continuous


monitoring of key features, ensuring stakeholders have real-time insights into

performance.


Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Product Managers, Engineers,


Designers, and Marketing teams to ensure data-driven decision-making throughout the

product lifecycle.


GA4 Optimization: Help to ensure best practices are followed on GA4 to maintain


consistency between different conversion funnels

Profile Needed


Experience: Demonstrate interest in data analytics and digital products.
Analytics Expertise: Basic understanding of Google Analytics (GA4 key features), and


of other analytics tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker Studio, Power BI).


Data Storytelling: Ability to transform complex data into clear, actionable insights


and present findings effectively to stakeholders.


Problem-Solving: Strong analytical mindset with a focus on solving complex


problems using data.


A/B Testing: Experience designing and interpreting A/B tests to evaluate product


hypotheses and feature performance.


Collaboration Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with


experience working in cross-functional teams.


Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering,


Mathematics), Economics, Marketing, Business or a related discipline.


Technical Skills: Familiarity with SQL, Python or R for data analysis is a plus. A basic


knowledge or interest of how websites and apps are built (e.g. HTML, CSS, JS) is also valued.

If you‚Äôre passionate about data, user behavior, digital products, and making a

meaningful impact in fintech, this is your opportunity to shine. Join Santander‚Äôs Digital

Channels team as a Product Data Analyst and help us shape the future of banking with data-driven insights!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
CAPGEMINI ENGINEERING

At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world‚Äôs most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.

YOUR ROLE

As a Data Analyst at PMI, you will play a key role in transforming data into actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making across the organization. You will work with tools such as SQL, Excel, Power BI, and Tableau to analyze trends, define key performance indicators (KPIs) like model bias and accuracy, and support data quality initiatives.

Key Responsibilities:


Support Data Privacy Impact Assessments (DPIA) and Business System Owner (BSO) approvals.
Define and maintain business terms using Atlan for metadata management.
Design and implement data quality checks within DSH.
Reconcile source data with historical records using DPaaS.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data integrity and alignment with business goals.
Present findings and insights in a clear, concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


YOUR PROFILE


Proven experience with SQL and Business Intelligence tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Strong proficiency in Excel and data visualization techniques.
Familiarity with data quality and metadata management tools such as Atlan, Snowflake, and DSH is a plus.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
A proactive approach to problem-solving and continuous improvement.


What You‚Äôll Love About Working Here


Join a multicultural and inclusive team environment.
Enjoy a supportive atmosphere promoting work-life balance.
Hybrid work.
Your career growth is central to our mission. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professionals are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
Access valuable training and certifications in cutting-edge technologies.
Engage in exciting national and international projects.
Health and life insurance.
Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations.
Great office locations.


Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you‚Äôd like, where you‚Äôll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you‚Äôll be able to reimagine what‚Äôs possible. Join us and help the world‚Äôs leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst ‚Äì Commercial
Description:
Location

Hybrid in Lisbon (minimum of 2 days a week from the office)

SHAPE THE FUTURE OF PRIVACY WITH USERCENTRICS

Usercentrics is a global leader in data privacy and privacy-led marketing solutions. We believe there is no need for a trade-off between growth and privacy compliance. Our vision is to unlock the potential of data privacy to empower a thriving digital ecosystem. We work with companies to create a healthy balance between data-driven business and privacy-led marketing for every size of enterprise. Our customers build trust with their users through improved transparency and control to drastically improve marketing and monetization, while achieving full privacy compliance.

We are seeking a highly skilled Business Data Analyst to join our BI Team, with a dedicated focus on supporting the Commercial Team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis, funnel analysis, and commercial performance metrics to deliver actionable insights that drive revenue growth and sales efficiency. You will act as a bridge between data analysis and commercial strategy, enabling data-driven decisions and optimizing commercial operations.

Your Tasks


Act as a dedicated BI partner to the Commercial Team, providing insights to improve sales performance, pipeline management, and revenue generation.
Conduct funnel analysis to understand and optimize the sales process, identifying bottlenecks and areas for improvement.
Analyze sales data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement in sales operations and strategies.
Monitor and report on key sales performance metrics, including pipeline health, win rates, deal velocity, average deal size, etc
Design, develop, and maintain dashboards in Power BI, providing stakeholders with visibility into sales performance and funnel progression.
Use SQL to query and manipulate data from various sources, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Collaborate with commercial leaders to identify opportunities for improvement and provide actionable recommendations based on data insights.
Support forecasting efforts by analyzing historical data and trends, enabling accurate revenue projections.
Stay updated on sales trends, tools, and best practices to continuously enhance reporting and analysis.


You Bring


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Data Analytics, Marketing, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, with a focus on B2B SaaS GTM performance and funnel analysis.
Intermediate skills in SQL for querying and analyzing data.
Expertise in Power BI (or similar tools) for creating dashboards, visualizations, and reports.
Strong understanding of sales metrics and KPIs, such as Customer Lifetime Value (CLV), Lead Conversion Rates, and Sales Cycle Length.
Proven experience in conducting and interpreting funnel analysis to optimize sales processes.
Exceptional communication skills to present insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong business acumen with the ability to translate data into actionable recommendations for the sales team.
Experience collaborating with V- and C-level stakeholders, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives.
Growth mindset and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
High degree of proactivity and self-sufficiency, capable of identifying opportunities and driving insights independently


Why join Usercentrics?


Joining Usercentrics means becoming part of a fast-growing, diverse and international team of tech enthusiasts and entrepreneurially-minded who build our success story together
Company culture is important to us - we strive to continuously develop a positive, vibrant and inspiring environment that enables everyone to thrive both personally and professionally
Get involved! We have plenty of initiatives and love to see people from all department enthusiastically participating and shaping our future together in different cross-department projects
Your work-life balance is important to us too - we offer flexible working hours, hybrid working and the possibility of workcations (in accordance with our company policy)
We always remember to have fun along the way, both in our day-to-day work and at our regular team events on site in our offices in Munich, Copenhagen, Odense, Lisbon and Prague or online
You are the most valuable asset to our company which is why we‚Äôre happy to offer awesome benefits like our personal development budget, job-related language courses and a lot more (depending on your location) to focus on your well being


About Us

We are driven by our values #BeBrave, #BetterTogether, #LeadbyExample, #InnovateWithPurpose, #PassionForPrivacy, #GiveBack and #ComeAsYouAre. They show what we believe in and how we work. They help make our team special and guide us in everything we do. They're the heart of our company and inspire us to do our best every day.

We strive to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment (DEI) where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential. We believe that our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are our greatest strengths ‚Äî so we are committed to building with them as we foster innovation and drive our success.

We recognize that this is an ongoing journey. We commit to listening and to continuous learning, growth, and improvement. By embracing DEI principles, we will create a more just and equitable society, and we are proud to play our part in making this vision a reality.

We are #BetterTogether.

Title: Product Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Location

Hybrid in Lisbon (minimum of 2-3 days a week from the office)

SHAPE THE FUTURE OF PRIVACY WITH USERCENTRICS

Usercentrics is a global leader in data privacy and privacy-led marketing solutions. We believe there is no need for a trade-off between growth and privacy compliance. Our vision is to unlock the potential of data privacy to empower a thriving digital ecosystem. We work with companies to create a healthy balance between data-driven business and privacy-led marketing for every size of enterprise. Our customers build trust with their users through improved transparency and control to drastically improve marketing and monetization, while achieving full privacy compliance.

We‚Äôre looking for a Product Data Analyst who thrives at the intersection of data, product

strategy, and business impact. In this role, you‚Äôll act as a bridge between data and product

teams , helping drive better decision-making through insight, instrumentation, and strong

stakeholder collaboration.

Your Tasks


Partner with Product Managers, Designers, and Engineers to identify key metrics and turn product data into actionable insights
Act as the PM for data-related initiatives that support the product organization(dashboards, tracking plans, user behavior models, etc.)
Own the instrumentation strategy for product features, ensuring accurate and scalable tracking using tools like Amplitude
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand needs, prioritize requests, and translate them into data products and solutions
Build and maintain dashboards and reports (Power BI or similar) to support decision-making
Communicate complex findings in a clear, business-friendly way to non-technical stakeholders
Support experimentation frameworks and help define success metrics
Ensure data quality and consistency across platforms and teams


You Bring


Solid business acumen and a strong understanding of product development lifecycle
Hands-on experience with product analytics tools (Amplitude required, Mixpanel or similar a plus)
Intermediate SQL skills, able to write clean, optimized queries
Experience with Power BI or similar BI tools (Looker, Tableau, etc.)
Excellent communication skills, you can explain data to non-data people with clarity and confidence
A proactive, collaborative mindset, you're comfortable prioritizing, managing stakeholders, and acting as the ‚Äúgo-to‚Äù person for product data
Experience working closely with Product, Design, or Engineering teams


NICE TO HAVE


Familiarity with event tracking plans, instrumentation workflows, or CDPs
Experience working in SaaS, B2B, or product-led growth environments
Exposure to A/B testing, growth analytics, or behavioral segmentation


Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of colour are

less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Usercentrics we are

dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you‚Äôre excited about this

role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job

description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or

other roles.

Why join Usercentrics?


Joining Usercentrics means becoming part of a fast-growing, diverse and international team of tech enthusiasts and entrepreneurially-minded who build our success story together
Company culture is important to us - we strive to continuously develop a positive, vibrant and inspiring environment that enables everyone to thrive both personally and professionally
Get involved! We have plenty of initiatives and love to see people from all department enthusiastically participating and shaping our future together in different cross-department projects
Your work-life balance is important to us too - we offer flexible working hours, hybrid working and the possibility of workcations (in accordance with our company policy)
We always remember to have fun along the way, both in our day-to-day work and at our regular team events on site in our offices in Munich, Copenhagen, Odense, Lisbon and Prague or online
You are the most valuable asset to our company which is why we‚Äôre happy to offer awesome benefits like our personal development budget, job-related language courses and a lot more (depending on your location) to focus on your well being


About Us

We are driven by our values #BeBrave, #BetterTogether, #LeadbyExample, #InnovateWithPurpose, #PassionForPrivacy, #GiveBack and #ComeAsYouAre. They show what we believe in and how we work. They help make our team special and guide us in everything we do. They're the heart of our company and inspire us to do our best every day.

Title: Data Curator
Description:
Shape the future of innovation, startups & economies

Dealroom is the world‚Äôs startup and venture capital database, used by leading teams like Accel, Index, Atomico, Google, Microsoft, AWS, SAP, and 100+ governments, to discover the world‚Äôs next generation of transformative companies.

We‚Äôre on a mission to accelerate innovation by empowering decision-makers with the most comprehensive data on startups, scaleups, and ecosystems.

Joining Dealroom means working at the confluence of AI, big data, and venture capital and acting as a catalyst at the heart of startup ecosystems. We value relentless client focus, transparency, openness, and candour - the freedom to take risks, admit failures, and speak openly.

About The Data Curation Team

Join our team of data analysts and content curators to improve the quality and accuracy of our data, and to elevate the experience of our users. This role is ideal for team players and problem solvers with an investigative mind looking to enter the world of startups and venture capital. You will develop skills in data quality and classification while expanding your technical toolkit and co-creating scalable solutions. You'll often work directly with our clients.

As a Data Curator, you‚Äôll


Ensure data quality through curation, desk research, classification, content review, and moderation.
Support data operations workflows and assist engineering teams.
Monitor and improve data quality metrics.
Contribute to developing scalable data management solutions.


What You Bring


Academic Credentials: A completed Bachelor's degree in (Business) Information Technology, Finance, Economics, Content Management, or related fields.
Interests: Data and data management tools, from GenAI to Python and BigQuery.
Passion: A demonstrated enthusiasm for technology, startups, and venture capital markets.
Mindset: A proactive, accountable, and urgent approach to work.
Adaptability: Comfort in a fast-paced startup environment where continuous learning, OKRs, ongoing feedback, and curiosity drive success.
Eligibility: Eligibility to work in the EU, residency in the Lisbon area, and fluency in English. Additional language skills are welkom / wilkommen / bienvenido / kyaosopartaal.


What We Bring To The Deal


Ownership: A role where you truly own your work. Show us your capabilities, and we‚Äôll support your growth.
Comprehensive Benefits: Enjoy benefits like a laptop of your choice, flexible hours, a fully equipped home office setup, travel allowances, a development budget, weekly workout sessions, and more.
Global & Inclusive Culture: Join a diverse team spanning over 25 nationalities.
Vibrant Workplace: Work in a dynamic environment in the heart of Lisbon (Baixa-Chiado) with flexible hybrid options.
Meritocratic Environment: We value entrepreneurial thinking and are committed to turning innovative ideas into reality.


Ready to accelerate the future of innovation with us? Share your story, and let‚Äôs create something transformative together.

Title: Data Analytics and Business Intelligence Senior (M/W)
Description:
Company Description

VANTIVA, headquartered in Paris, France and formerly known as Technicolor, is a global technology leader in designing, developing and supplying innovative products and solutions that connect consumers around the world to the content and services they love ‚Äì whether at home, at work or in other smart spaces.

VANTIVA has also earned a solid reputation for optimizing supply chain performance by leveraging its decades-long expertise in high-precision manufacturing, logistics, fulfilment and distribution. With operations throughout the Americas, Asia Pacific and EMEA, VANTIVA is recognized as a strategic partner by leading firms across various vertical industries, including network service providers, software companies and video game creators for over 25 years.

Our relationships with the film and entertainment industry goes back over 100 years by providing end-to-end solutions for our clients. VANTIVA is committed to the highest standards of corporate social responsibility and sustainability across all aspects of their operations.

For more information, please visit www.vantiva.com

Job Description

The BI expert will contribute to all aspects of BI development, covering Vantiva applications and supporting the implementation of the data strategy roadmap.

This role is critical in designing, developing, and maintaining data warehousing, reporting solutions, and BI applications. It requires a strong foundation in business intelligence, analytics, and functional expertise to interpret business requirements effectively.

The candidate will drive solution design, customization, and development to resolve issues, enhance existing solutions, and deliver new business intelligence capabilities.

The ideal candidate thrives in complex technical environments, enjoys problem-solving, and is passionate about data and analytics.

Key Responsibilities


Align and implement data architecture to support data analytics, reporting needs, and business planning requirements.
Ensure BI system health and performance by proposing, implementing, and monitoring best practices.
Maintain data reliability across all layers of the data platform and satellite systems.
Develop best practices for data visualization, dashboarding, planning, analytics, and application architecture.
Conduct root cause analysis and provide recommendations to leadership to mitigate risks and improve efficiency.
Ensure compliance with core solution principles and industry regulations for data handling and reporting.
Implement and maintain data security measures to protect sensitive information.
Handle user support requests, prioritizing them based on business impact.
Perform necessary system configurations and developments as needed.
Collaborate extensively with business stakeholders to understand reporting & analytics needs and deliver solutions that meet their requirements.


Qualifications


Highly motivated, proactive, and a self-starter with a strong sense of ownership.
Strong experience in analyzing, diagnosing, designing, planning, executing, and evaluating BI solutions while meeting time, cost, and quality targets.
Excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal, and documentation skills.
10+ years of experience in data foundation, data management, data governance, and insights generation.
Senior-level expertise in SAP BI architecture and development tools, with a focus on BW/4HANA.
Hands-on experience with BW/4HANA, IP/BPC, SAC, BODS, BOBJ (Webi), and Analysis for Excel.
Exposure to HANA administration, including data provisioning, data tiering, security, and performance optimization.
Proficiency in ABAP development is required (programs, functions, object classes, WebDynpro).
Strong SQL skills with experience in query performance tuning.
Knowledge of MS Power BI, Azure Data Lake, and Data Factory is an advantage.
Databricks experience is a strong plus completed by a proficiency in Python.


Additional Information

The position is located in Lisbon, Portugal.

Our most important asset is our People

Vantiva‚Äôs success greatly relies on our people‚Äôs energy, motivation, and talent.

We are dedicated to cultivating a workforce that embraces and celebrates diversity as we believe our differences drive our creativity, and innovation.

We are proactive in supporting equality and maintaining an inclusive work environment, developing, and enhancing career opportunities for all.

If you require a reasonable accommodation at any step of the application process, please let us know by answering the dedicated question in this application form.

Title: Data Analyst - IT
Description:
Join our team at AMGEN Capability Center Portugal, number 1 company in Best Workplaces - https://www.greatplacetowork.pt/ - ranking in Portugal (category 201-500 employees) by the Great Place to Work Institute. We have a team of over 400 talented people and 40 different nationalities, diverse areas of expertise and professional experience that are shaping the future of healthcare. This is your chance to explore a world of opportunities in different areas such as Cybersecurity, Data & Analytics, Digital, Technology and Innovation, Finance, General & Admin, Human Resources, Regulatory Affairs and many more. In Lisbon's city center, our AMGEN office fosters innovation, excellence, and inspiration. Come thrive with us at AMGEN, supporting our mission To Serve Patients. What we do at AMGEN matters in

people‚Äôs lives.

Data Analyst - IT

LIVE

What You Will Do

Let‚Äôs do this. Let‚Äôs change the world.

In this vital role, you will support the delivery of emerging AI/ML capabilities within Amgen's Neural Nexus program. As part of the Commercial Technology Data & Analytics team, you will collaborate with product owners and cross-functional partners to help design, implement, and iterate on a layered ecosystem focused on DIAL (Data, Insights, Action, and Learning). This includes contributing to the development of an Agentic AI framework using agile methodologies. Are you a technology professional with a passion for commercial domains and a drive to innovate? Join a team that thrives on creativity and is dedicated to making life better through technology.


Collaborate with the Customer Data & Analytics (CD&A) team to help realize business value through the application of commercial data and emerging AI/ML technologies.
Support delivery activities within the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), partnering with Engineering and Product Management to shape roadmaps, prioritize releases, and maintain a refined product backlog.
Contribute to backlog management by helping break down Epics into Features and Sprint-ready User Stories, ensuring clear articulation of requirements and well-defined Acceptance Criteria and Definitions of Done.
Ensure non-functional requirements are represented and prioritized within the backlog to maintain performance, scalability, and compliance standards.
Collaborate with UX to align technical requirements, business processes, and scenarios with user-centered design.
Assist in the development and delivery of engaging product demonstrations for internal and external stakeholders.
Support documentation efforts to maintain accurate records of system configurations, processes, and enhancements.
Contribute to the launch and growth of Neural Nexus product teams focused on data connectivity, predictive modeling, and fast-cycle value delivery for commercial teams.
Provide input for governance discussions and help prepare materials to support executive alignment on technology strategy and investment.


WIN

What We Expect Of You

We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Specialist IS Business Analyst with a passion for innovation and a collaborative working style that partners effectively with business and technology leaders with these qualifications.

Basic Qualifications:


Master‚Äôs degree with 4 - 6 years of experience in Information Systems
Bachelor‚Äôs degree with 6 - 8 years of experience in Information Systems
Diploma with 10 - 12 years of experience in Information Systems
Experience with writing user requirements and acceptance criteria
Affinity to work in a DevOps environment and Agile mind set
Ability to work in a team environment, effectively interacting with others
Ability to meet deadlines and schedules and be accountable


Preferred Qualifications:

Must-Have Skills:


Excellent problem-solving skills and a passion for solving complex challenges in for AI-driven technologies
Experience with Agile software development methodologies (Scrum)
Superb communication skills and the ability to work with senior leadership with confidence and clarity
Has experience with writing user requirements and acceptance criteria in agile project management systems such as JIRA
Experience in managing product features for PI planning and developing product roadmaps and user journeys


Good-to-Have Skills:


Demonstrated expertise in data and analytics and related technology concepts
Understanding of data and analytics software systems strategy, governance, and infrastructure
Familiarity with low-code, no-code test automation software
Technical thought leadership
Able to communicate technical or complex subject matters in business terms
Jira Align experience
Experience of DevOps, Continuous Integration, and Continuous Delivery methodology


Soft Skills:


Able to work under minimal supervision
Excellent analytical and gap/fit assessment skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work effectively with global, virtual teams
High degree of initiative and self-motivation
Ability to manage multiple priorities successfully
Team-oriented, with a focus on achieving team goals
Strong presentation and public speaking skills


Technical Skills:


Experience with cloud-based data technologies (e.g., Databricks, Redshift, S3 buckets)
AWS (similar cloud-based platforms)
Experience with design patterns, data structures, test-driven development
Knowledge of NLP techniques for text analysis and sentiment analysis


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
A diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth, and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

Objects in your future are closer than they appear. Join us.

CAREERS.AMGEN.COM

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: Data Market Analyst ‚Äì Business Planning
Description:
Imagine a world with zero vehicle accidents, zero vehicle emissions, and wireless vehicle connectivity all around us. Every day, we move closer to making that world a reality. Aptiv‚Äôs passionate team of engineers and developers creates advanced safety systems, high-performance electrification solutions and data connectivity solutions so that automakers can bring advanced capabilities to more people around the globe. This is how we enable sustainable mobility and help to prevent accidents caused by human error.

Want to join us?

Your role:


Conduct internal planning data analysis, transform data into knowledge to provide input for decision, compare data with Market industry-level to support operational and strategic initiatives.
Monitor market share, competitive intelligence, product development trends and EDS portfolio to support market positioning reports.
Align data analysis with company‚Äôs strategic direction. Initiate and support market research and competitor analysis by developing automatization of different data sources.
Collaborate with external research and consulting firms to provide insights to internal functions and leadership.
Participate in customer studies and market environment analysis.
Maintain up-to-date understanding of the EMEA wiring harness market, including key drivers such as electrification, regulatory shifts, consumer behavior, and regional trends.
Contribute to general business planning tasks as needed and support Commercial Teams in regards current and future business.


Your Background


Graduate or Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field
Strong proficiency in SQL, Microsoft Excel, and Power BI.
Working knowledge of SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).
Excellent command of office applications, including PowerPoint and Excel.
Familiarity with Automotive product portfolios and market forecasting.
Experience in market research, data analysis, or a related function.
Fluent in English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Able to perform under pressure, work collaboratively, and meet deadlines.


Nice To Have Skills


Experience with VBA, Power Query, Power Pivot, or Power Automate.
Automotive supplier background or direct exposure to manufacturing and business planning in the automotive sector.


Why join us?


You can grow at Aptiv. Aptiv provides an inclusive work environment where all individuals can grow and develop, regardless of gender, ethnicity or beliefs.
You can have an impact. Safety is a core Aptiv value; we want a safer world for us and our children, one with: Zero fatalities, Zero injuries, Zero accidents.
You have support. We ensure you have the resources and support you need to take care of your family and your physical and mental health with a competitive health insurance package.

Imagine a world with zero vehicle accidents, zero vehicle emissions, and wireless vehicle connectivity all around us. Every day, we move closer to making that world a reality. Aptiv‚Äôs passionate team of engineers and developers creates advanced safety systems, high-performance electrification solutions and data connectivity solutions so that automakers can bring advanced capabilities to more people around the globe. This is how we enable sustainable mobility and help to prevent accidents caused by human error.

Want to join us?

Your role:

  • Conduct internal planning data analysis, transform data into knowledge to provide input for decision, compare data with Market industry-level to support operational and strategic initiatives.
  • Monitor market share, competitive intelligence, product development trends and EDS portfolio to support market positioning reports.
  • Align data analysis with company‚Äôs strategic direction. Initiate and support market research and competitor analysis by developing automatization of different data sources.
  • Collaborate with external research and consulting firms to provide insights to internal functions and leadership.
  • Participate in customer studies and market environment analysis.
  • Maintain up-to-date understanding of the EMEA wiring harness market, including key drivers such as electrification, regulatory shifts, consumer behavior, and regional trends.
  • Contribute to general business planning tasks as needed and support Commercial Teams in regards current and future business.

Your Background

  • Graduate or Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field
  • Strong proficiency in SQL, Microsoft Excel, and Power BI.
  • Working knowledge of SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).
  • Excellent command of office applications, including PowerPoint and Excel.
  • Familiarity with Automotive product portfolios and market forecasting.
  • Experience in market research, data analysis, or a related function.
  • Fluent in English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Able to perform under pressure, work collaboratively, and meet deadlines.

Nice To Have Skills

  • Experience with VBA, Power Query, Power Pivot, or Power Automate.
  • Automotive supplier background or direct exposure to manufacturing and business planning in the automotive sector.

Why join us?

  • You can grow at Aptiv. Aptiv provides an inclusive work environment where all individuals can grow and develop, regardless of gender, ethnicity or beliefs.
  • You can have an impact. Safety is a core Aptiv value; we want a safer world for us and our children, one with: Zero fatalities, Zero injuries, Zero accidents.
  • You have support. We ensure you have the resources and support you need to take care of your family and your physical and mental health with a competitive health insurance package.

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility. Title: Data Visualization Specialist
Description:
About The Job


We are seeking a talented Senior Data Visualization Expert to join the CIB Human Resources team. As a Senior Data Visualization Expert, you will play a crucial role in transforming complex HR data into clear and actionable insights through visually compelling representations. Your work will empower our HR teams to make data-driven decisions that drive the success of our organization


Your Main Activities Are


Data Visualization: Create visually appealing and interactive data visualizations, including charts, graphs, dashboards, and reports, using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms
Storytelling: Translate data findings into compelling narratives to convey insights effectively to HR and organizational stakeholders
Data Analysis: Analyse large volumes of HR data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement
Data Integration: Collaborate with the HR and IT teams to integrate and maintain data sources to ensure data accuracy and completeness. Play a key role in sprint planning and contribute in daily standup meetings to ensure on time delivery of new developments
Data Quality Assurance: Implement data validation and quality control procedures to ensure data accuracy and reliability
User Training: Train HR staff on interpreting and using visualized data for informed decision-making
Project Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support HR-related projects and initiative
Stay Current: Keep up-to-date with industry best practices and emerging data visualization tools and techniques
Provide end user support and follow up with IT teams on any production incidents/issues and ensure they are resolved in a timely manor


Profile And Skills To Success


Masters Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
At least 3 years of experience in data analysis and visualization, preferably in a Human Resources context
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Data driven mindset / exploratory data analysis
Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Ability to work collaboratively in a team and meet project deadlines
Flexibility: ability to work in a changing environment
Project management skills
Facilitate problem solving & collaboration


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Client Services & Data Analyst Internship
Description:
Keywords: Capital Markets, FX, FI, EQD, Structured Products, Rates, Credits, e-Commerce, Data Analytics, Client Support

Your Main Activities Are

Client Enablement


Responsible for managing and implementing all Client/User Enablement requests to BNP Paribas electronic trading platforms including our Single dealer Platform (Cortex Suites, Smart Derivatives), Multi Dealer platforms such as Bloomberg, Tradeweb, FXall, 360t and FIX API Connections
Relationship with other departments - Sales, Trading and IT Support Teams to manage the configuration of Pricing and Client margin across various platforms


Business Support


Resolve issues across all BNP Paribas electronic products and services, ensuring a quick and effective resolution
Ensure clients are connected, being priced and able to trade at all times
Monitor the status of all systems and electronic trade flows
Using data-mining analysis tools to identify issues
Provide business support to Trading & Sales
Working closely with IT, Credit Risk, Legal, Compliance, etc.


Pricing Configuration


Manage all pricing and tier changes for Sales and Trading in the respective gateways
Manage price controls and limits across all products, ensuring all changes are properly controlled and approved prior to implementation


EBusiness Optimisation


Client Engagement Activities: monitor new client activity as well as dormant clients and users, follow up on credit and limit issues
Conduct client feedback surveys to ensure ECS is meeting customer expectations, improving service levels and product development as needed.
Record all Client Engagement activities in our ecommerce CRM tool to ensure accurate and meaningful MIS around Client Engagement
Constantly review manual process and suggest new operating models to improve efficiency


Profile And Skills To Success


Academic background in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics or similar areas
An overall understanding and interest in the financial world
Fluency in English
Excellent communication skills and client focus
Strong team work while being able to work autonomously
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to work under tight deadlines and organisational skills
Strong Excel knowledge
Python and other IT coding Skills - (Intermediate)


About The Team

Electronic Client Solutions (ECS) is a global team within the COO group, with teams based in London, Lisbon, New York and Singapore, ECS represents the backbone of BNP Paribas's Electronic trading offering.

Its core function is to provide a single point of contact for Client queries for all our Electronic products and services. ECS supports Clients, Trading venues and external counterparties, is responsible for Client enablement, Client Support and vendor relationships across all our Ecommerce platforms.

Responsibilities

ECS supports BNP PARIBAS clients on Single dealer and Multi dealer platforms in conjunction with Sales and Trading. Its responsibilities fall into three main business/product lines organised respectively into three sub-teams:


FX Cash / Options / Algos / Commodities
Fixed Income - Rates / Credit / Structured Products / Derivatives
Structured Products / Derivatives


ECS are a critical component of Electronic Business & Markets group, providing the highest level of service to our external and internal clients to position BNP Paribas as a leading provider of Electronic Markets solutions.

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

HTML:
Keywords: Capital Markets, FX, FI, EQD, Structured Products, Rates, Credits, e-Commerce, Data Analytics, Client Support

Your Main Activities Are

Client Enablement

  • Responsible for managing and implementing all Client/User Enablement requests to BNP Paribas electronic trading platforms including our Single dealer Platform (Cortex Suites, Smart Derivatives), Multi Dealer platforms such as Bloomberg, Tradeweb, FXall, 360t and FIX API Connections
  • Relationship with other departments - Sales, Trading and IT Support Teams to manage the configuration of Pricing and Client margin across various platforms

Business Support

  • Resolve issues across all BNP Paribas electronic products and services, ensuring a quick and effective resolution
  • Ensure clients are connected, being priced and able to trade at all times
  • Monitor the status of all systems and electronic trade flows
  • Using data-mining analysis tools to identify issues
  • Provide business support to Trading & Sales
  • Working closely with IT, Credit Risk, Legal, Compliance, etc.

Pricing Configuration

  • Manage all pricing and tier changes for Sales and Trading in the respective gateways
  • Manage price controls and limits across all products, ensuring all changes are properly controlled and approved prior to implementation

EBusiness Optimisation

  • Client Engagement Activities: monitor new client activity as well as dormant clients and users, follow up on credit and limit issues
  • Conduct client feedback surveys to ensure ECS is meeting customer expectations, improving service levels and product development as needed.
  • Record all Client Engagement activities in our ecommerce CRM tool to ensure accurate and meaningful MIS around Client Engagement
  • Constantly review manual process and suggest new operating models to improve efficiency

Profile And Skills To Success

  • Academic background in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics or similar areas
  • An overall understanding and interest in the financial world
  • Fluency in English
  • Excellent communication skills and client focus
  • Strong team work while being able to work autonomously
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Ability to work under tight deadlines and organisational skills
  • Strong Excel knowledge
  • Python and other IT coding Skills - (Intermediate)

About The Team

Electronic Client Solutions (ECS) is a global team within the COO group, with teams based in London, Lisbon, New York and Singapore, ECS represents the backbone of BNP Paribas's Electronic trading offering.

Its core function is to provide a single point of contact for Client queries for all our Electronic products and services. ECS supports Clients, Trading venues and external counterparties, is responsible for Client enablement, Client Support and vendor relationships across all our Ecommerce platforms.

Responsibilities

ECS supports BNP PARIBAS clients on Single dealer and Multi dealer platforms in conjunction with Sales and Trading. Its responsibilities fall into three main business/product lines organised respectively into three sub-teams:

  • FX Cash / Options / Algos / Commodities
  • Fixed Income - Rates / Credit / Structured Products / Derivatives
  • Structured Products / Derivatives

ECS are a critical component of Electronic Business & Markets group, providing the highest level of service to our external and internal clients to position BNP Paribas as a leading provider of Electronic Markets solutions.

Title: Data Protection Analyst
Description:
At Paymentology, we‚Äôre redefining what‚Äôs possible in the payments space. As the first truly global issuer-processor, we give banks and fintechs the technology and talent to launch and manage Mastercard, Visa, and UnionPay cards at scale - across more than 60 countries.

Our advanced, multi-cloud platform delivers real-time data, unmatched scalability, and the flexibility of shared or dedicated processing instances. It's this global reach and innovation that sets us apart.

We're looking for a Data Protection Analyst to play a key role in enhancing our data privacy framework. Your work will help protect the privacy of our customers and employees, ensuring that our Privacy practices are transparent and secure.

In addition, you will get involved with implementing the Privacy and AI tools that support the privacy governance workflows. Your day-to-day work will involve collaborating with cross-functional teams and making recommendations to improve our privacy and governance practices.

What you get to do::

Data Privacy Framework


Strengthen Paymentology‚Äôs data privacy risk framework, implementing robust policies and procedures aligned with the GDPR, and other global privacy regulations and best practices. Work closely with global cross-functional stakeholders to support team projects and goals.


Privacy Management System


Support the implementation of our new Privacy Management System, working directly with the vendor and internal stakeholders to configure system settings, create assessment templates and establish efficient process workflows, documentation, and reporting.


Data Mapping & Governance


Work closely with designated teams to conduct comprehensive data mapping exercises across the company to identify personal data flows, establishing data governance structures and control mechanisms.


Risk Assessment & Compliance


Run the Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs) and Records of Processing Activities (RoPA), and AI Risk Governance activities, and support supplier assessments, based on privacy risks. Conduct re-assessments of personal data processing activities based on risk.


Regulatory Compliance Management


Ensure adherence to GDPR and other relevant global data protection regulations, monitoring regulatory developments and implementing necessary changes to maintain compliance.


Privacy by Design and by Default


Provide advice and guidance to the business on data protection, privacy by design and AI-related questions and risks. Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Procurement, Information Security, Legal and Compliance to balance privacy and business objectives. Support the review and assessment of Data Protection Agreements (DPAs).


Controls Testing & Improvement


Perform ongoing assessments of privacy controls, identifying areas for improvement and implementing corrective measures to strengthen data protection practices. Maintain comprehensive documentation of findings and prepare reports for senior management.


Incident Management


Act as key point of contact for reporting and handling of personal data incidents, implementing effective response and coordinating remediation efforts to minimise impact and avoid reoccurrence.


Data Subject Rights Management


Manage the processing of Data Subject Access Requests (DSARs), such as erasure, rectification, portability, and ensure timely and compliant responses.


Training & Awareness


ÔªøDevelop and deliver privacy training, raising awareness of data protection responsibilities across the organisation.


Requirements:

What it takes to succeed:


ÔªøMinimum of 3 - 5 years of experience in data privacy, compliance, or risk management roles, ideally within the payments industry or similarly regulated environments.
Strong understanding of global data protection regulations, particularly GDPR, EU AI Act (or equivalent regulations), privacy by design principles and their practical application in business processes and systems.
Experience with implementing and administering privacy management frameworks and tools, e.g. OneTrust or similar.
Proven track record in conducting data mapping exercises, DPIAs, and maintaining Records of Processing Activities (RoPA).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to assess complex privacy risks and develop effective mitigation strategies.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
Proficiency in using Microsoft Office suite, with strong skills in Excel and PowerPoint.
Strong stakeholder management skills to address issues and reach consensus in a complex and ambiguous environment.
Ability to translate complex regulatory requirements into practical operational controls.
Effective organizational and project management skills.


Preferred Qualifications:


Globally recognized privacy certifications (e.g., IAPP CIPP/E, CIPM, or equivalent).
Experience with privacy management platforms similar to OneTrust.
Familiarity with information security standards such as ISO 27001.
Experience working in a global organization with multi-jurisdictional privacy requirements.
Background in financial services, payments, or fintech industries.


What you can look forward to::

At Paymentology, it‚Äôs not just about building great payment technology, it‚Äôs about building a company where people feel they belong and their work matters. You‚Äôll be part of a diverse, global team that‚Äôs genuinely committed to making a positive impact through what we do. Whether you‚Äôre working across time zones or getting involved in initiatives that support local communities, you‚Äôll find real purpose in your work - and the freedom to grow in a supportive, forward-thinking environment.

Whether you‚Äôre working across time zones or getting involved in initiatives that support local communities, you‚Äôll find real purpose in your work - and the freedom to grow in a supportive, forward-thinking environment.

Title: Traded Risk Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The mission of RISK Market & Financial Institutions (‚ÄúRISK MFI‚Äù) is to provide the Senior Management of the Group, of the RISK Function and of Global Markets (‚ÄúGM‚Äù) and of Securities and Services with full transparency and dynamic analysis and monitoring of market, counterparty, valuation and liquidity risks originated and managed by CIB and of credit risks on Financial Institutions in order to assist them in their risk decision making and monitoring
The Digital team within RISK MFI review processes and develops light IT solutions to automate the many risk management processes and analysis dashboards of the RISK MFI department
Each project is undertaken in a predefined environment and within specific guidelines built in coordination with the RISK IT department
There is a strong focus in improving the user experience and exploiting efficiently and timely the vast amount of available data
An understanding of the risk management purpose behind those processes is therefore key
Past projects have focused on automation of processes in Python, app development with interactive visualisations, BOT development, APIs, etc
The role encompasses the maintenance and support of existing tools, taking the lead on new developments, the close collaboration with the risk managers to shape an efficient visualisation of the data and related workflow of decisions
The Digital team works in close collaboration with the RISK IT department, making sure best coding practices are followed. It allows for a smooth the path to production of the tools developed by the team. For many projects, the Digital team directly codes in the official production systems under the guidance of RISK IT colleagues
The team uses a variety of technologies but specialises in Python, with some exposure to HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc
The team is based in London, Lisbon and Porto and operates following Agile principles . The team works alongside around 500 people focusing on Market, Counterparty and Liquidity risk topics


Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders


Profile and Skills to Success


Master‚Äôs Degree in Finance / Mathematics / Science / Engineering or related
At least 2 years of experience in a relevant data analysis field
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in Python
Attention to detail / rigor
Ability to synthetise / simplify
Analytical ability
Client focused
Organisational skills
Proactivity


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Senior Analyst
Description:
About Us

Indie Campers, the go-to campervan Marketplace, is on a mission of making road trips available to everyone. Thanks to its digital approach and customer-centric orientation, Indie Campers has developed a strong booking experience and high-quality road trips at affordable prices.

With over one million nights rented through our travel platform, we have welcomed more than 300,000 travelers from 169 countries. We offer a comprehensive and expanding array of road trip possibilities: short-term RV rentals, long-term campervan subscriptions, and the possibility of buying one of our vehicles available for sale.

Rooted in a deep technological focus, our challenges are both exciting and demanding and require top talent and motivation to be successfully pursued. We are growing our team and looking for those interested in pursuing this dream with us and joining an ever-developing journey.

THE ROLE

As Indie Campers Data Senior Analyst you will be in charge of our Fleet Allocation & Relocation strategy for all the countries we operate in, across Europe, North America and Ocenia. You will report directly to the Director of Revenue Management and work very closely with our Logistics, Field Operations, Fleet Strategy, Marketing and Revenue teams from our Lisbon, Portugal HQ.

WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON?


Lead the Annual Fleet allocation plan.
Control and measure fleet relocation cost, together with Logistics.
Manage the Fleet Relocation process, together with fulfilment teams - Logistics, Fleet and Field Ops.
Coordenate with Revenue and Marketing, to distribute available stock in most relevant locations, according to external events, cluster events, and promotions.
Develop analysis tools to forecast and review fleet allocation adjustments through our stock relocation algorithm.
As our Campervan Demand expert, you'll be one of the main advisers on which car models to procure, and where to place them.


WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?


Minimum 5 years of experience, preferably in industries where stock is both limited and mobile.
Experience in supply organisation to match demand levels, preferably in a rent-a-car, airline, transportation or supply-chain environment.
You have experience in developing complex forecast models and in data analytics.
Bachelor's or Master's in Management, Economics, Finance or Engineering.
You are fluent in English, spoken and written


WHAT WE OFFER?


A dynamic position with a global scope in a young, fast-growing, and innovative company;
Continuous training and coaching to develop your skills;
Competitive package including private health insurance, Indie Benefits and complementary road trips world-wide (subject to availability);
International work environment located in the heart of Lisbon.


Are you ready to Go Indie?
