  • Competitive package including private health insurance, Indie Benefits and complementary road trips world-wide (subject to availability);
  • International work environment located in the heart of Lisbon.

Are you ready to Go Indie?

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Data Analyst will work on a new product (UMD) of a global project focused on the evolution of third-party data ecosystems would aim to streamline the integration of new data and technologies such as data virtualization, APIs, etc., enhancing the accessibility and real-time availability of data across systems
UMD has the objective and ambition to build and deploy a matching solution live having as a target matching as a service capability with unique identification to all third parties publishing through the Businesses and locations (facilitating cross-selling, making Group-level reports reliable) and new data collection application delivered
The Data Analyst will be in charge of the quality, steering follow-up, building indicators, define and follow remediation actions (including potential architecture change ir new external data sources to be added)
A deep knowledge of banking activities & data (Referentials) knowledge, quality, follow and build indicators
The global aim of the project ensure high data quality and consistency across various REFERENTIALS data sources and reducing discrepancies in reporting and closing figures by performing a deep analyses on the existing data and sources and transform the processes and technologies used, including the existing REFERENTIALS. The goal is to streamline workflows, improving time to market and enabling faster and more accurate insights for better decision-making


Your Main Activities Are


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management. Responsibilities
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making.
Actively manage clients.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.
Coach as necessary more junior members of the team.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders


Profile And Skills To Success


Educational background: Information Technology & computer Science / Information Systems or Business Management
More than 4 years of Experience as Data Analyst or similar role
Professional experience in Referential administration (data management, database‚Ä¶) desirable;
Availability and customer orientation skills;
Strong analytical mind, problem solving, planning & organization skills.
Analytical and goal oriented;
Excellent attention to details, Rigour & Accuracy;
Pro-active attitude with ability to work in a fast changing and demanding environment;
Team spirit and at ease with multi-tasking;
Ability to report.
Strong interpersonal communication and presentation skills (spoken and written);
English is mandatory (B2 Level minimum);
French is a plus;
Proficiency in MS Office tools, Power BI, Tableau
Experience with databases and data management
Financial Data knowledge desirable
Client focus


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst for Wealth Management
Description:
About The Job


BNP Paribas Wealth Management (WM) is a leading global private bank and the leading private bank in the Eurozone with more than ‚Ç¨400 billion in assets under management. Present in 18 countries (Europe, Asia and the Middle East), it employs more than 6800 professionals who support clients in the protection, growth and transfer of their assets while aiming to build a sustainable future
You will work for WM HO Data Office. You will be working in the Data Management and Business Analytics team located in Lisbon in close relationship with the Head of Data Analytics based in Paris
The WM HO Data Office's mission is to manage all topics related to Data Governance and Strategy for Wealth Management incl. Data Management and Protection and Data Analytics
With a strong acceleration in the digitalization of business, data plays a key role in our strategic plan. To meet this challenge, one of the team's missions is to promote the use of Data visualization (Power BI/Tableau) and Analytics tools to fully exploit the potential of data and improve decision-making


Your Main Activities Are


In this context, we need to strengthen the team with a Data Analyst whose main missions are to
Build and automate Power BI/Tableau dashboards to better manage and facilitate decision-making within Wealth Management, especially for Head Office and International Market. You will be required to support the different departments / entities in the implementation of their use cases (e.g. monitoring of Financial KPIs, Sales Steering use case, among others)
Industrialize the different data flows with Power Query/DataIku to facilitate the preparation and exploitation of data
Model certain indicators/scores via DataIku
Actively contribute to the animation of Wealth Management Data community
Work on the governance of analytics tools to improve the quality of controls and reporting at WM HO Data Office level

Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Information Technology and Computer Science
At least 2 years of Experience in Data Analytics
Knowledge of the data schema, querying, and relational schema
Language and queries Dax, Power Query and Python
Proficiency in Data Viz tools (Power BI/Tableau) and data modelling (Dataiku)
Fluency in English
Adaptability
Proactivity
Result-driven, constantly looking for ways to improve your performance
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork in a collaborative / transversal way
Ability to share and to communicate with different stakeholders (IT/Non-IT)


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees‚Äô wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we‚Äôre able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Responsibilities


Act as the main analyst supporting the development of a monitoring and observability layer across operational systems.
Translating business requirements into clear and actionable KPIs and monitoring structures.
Conduct data analyses, generate reports and dashboards with tools such as Power BI.
Use query languages (SQL) and data manipulation in modern environments (Azure, Databricks).
Applying observability and monitoring concepts using tools such as Zabbix and Dynatrace.
Working with data architectures, systems integration and traceability.
Facilitating workshops and aligning technical and business teams.


Essential Skills


Mininum experience of 8 years on similar roles.
Proven experience in data analysis, visualisation and monitoring frameworks.
Expertise in tools such as Power BI and languages such as SQL.
Experience with cloud data platforms (preferably Azure/Databricks).
Knowledge of system observability and monitoring tools.
Strong communication and facilitation skills with diverse stakeholders.
Critical thinking, attention to detail and adaptability to different cultures and environments.
Good knowledge of English.

Title: IoT Data Eng and Analyst
Description:
Join Us

At Vodafone, we‚Äôre not just shaping the future of connectivity for our customers ‚Äì we‚Äôre shaping the future for everyone who joins our team. When you work with us, you‚Äôre part of a global mission to connect people, solve complex challenges, and create a sustainable and more inclusive world. If you want to grow your career whilst finding the perfect balance between work and life, Vodafone offers the opportunities to help you belong and make a real impact.

What You‚Äôll Do


Take ownership and accountability of Analytics Data Pipeline data Modelling and design solutions for (IoT) Analytics and BI projects
Help facilitate discussions and conflict resolution, alternatives or different approaches & ensure no impact on the delivery of projects
Manage stakeholders and vendor interfaces as required for technical delivery and report on project progress & activities



Who You Are


BSc or MSc level degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or Telecommunications
Ability to understand architecture, network design & technical issues to drive effective agile delivery
Creative and efficient in proposing solutions to complex, time-critical problems
Proven hands-on experience in developing and deploying Analytics solutions
Knowledge on Analytics solutions, BI solution and data modelling
Knowledge on Redshift Data Modelling and SQL
Deep Knowledge of DevOps tools and CI/CD
Experience with AWS Service or Goggle Cloud Service
Knowledge on Telcon Business (OSS and BSS)
Ability to maintain calm attitude during difficult situations and handle pressure situations
Agile Methodology embracement
Strong team player with an ability to identify and remove impediments or conflicts that interfere with the ability of the team to deliver the sprint & project goals
Self-starter & self-motivated with a drive to identify opportunities for improvement across the agile delivery processes
Highly independent, takes ownership, does not need to be told what to do and seeks feedback and execute actions
Fluent in Portuguese and English



Not a perfect fit?

Worried that you don‚Äôt meet all the desired criteria exactly? At Vodafone we are passionate about empowering people and creating a workplace where everyone can thrive, whatever their personal or professional background. If you‚Äôre excited about this role but your experience doesn‚Äôt align exactly with every part of the job description, we encourage you to still apply as you may be the right candidate for this role or another opportunity.

What's In It For You


Hybrid Work Model - Flexible hybrid work model with 8-10 in-office days per month, managed by team leaders
Vodafone Products and Services - Employees get a mobile phone, free communication plan, data card, and various discounts on services and products
Recognition - Recognition programs for innovative, creative, high-potential employees and exemplary behaviors
Health and Well-being - Well-being Program offers nutrition and psychological consultations, webinars, workshops, and discounts on various services and products
Learning - Access to Communities of Practice and a customizable digital training platform with high-quality content (namely Harvard Business Publishing and Skillsoft)
Local and International Mobility - Internal recruitment with local and international rotation opportunities across departments and roles



Who We Are

We are a leading international Telco, serving millions of customers. At Vodafone, we believe that connectivity is a force for good. If we use it for the things that really matter, it can improve people's lives and the world around us. Through our technology we empower people, connecting everyone regardless of who they are or where they live and we protect the planet, whilst helping our customers do the same.

Belonging at Vodafone isn't a concept; it's lived, breathed, and cultivated through everything we do. You'll be part of a global and diverse community, with many different minds, abilities, backgrounds and cultures. ;We're committed to increase diversity, ensure equal representation, and make Vodafone a place everyone feels safe, valued and included.

If you require any reasonable adjustments or have an accessibility request as part of your recruitment journey, for example, extended time or breaks in between online assessments, please refer to https://careers.vodafone.com/application-adjustments/ for guidance.

Together we can.

Title: AI Analyst
Description:
Job Description

The Position

AI Analyst

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated AI Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for identifying AI & Automation opportunities within our organization and designing a fit-for-purpose solution. This role involves working closely with cross-functional teams to understand business needs, analyze processes, and recommend AI-driven improvements.

Organon is a Women‚Äôs Health Company that believes in a better and healthier every day for every woman! We are a passionate, global community of thousands dedicated to redefining the future of women‚Äôs health. Our mission is to deliver impactful medicines and solutions for a healthier every day. But what really makes it work at Organon is our people.

We‚Äôre looking for real, passionate team players, curious innovators, forward thinkers, empowered by the idea of shaping their career, and ready to bring their fire to embrace change and the opportunities it brings for progress.

At Organon, you‚Äôll get to enjoy the best of both worlds: the open, agile, collaborative culture of a start-up, and operating at the scale of a fortune 500 company with an international footprint that serves people in more than 140 markets.

It‚Äôs going to be an exciting future‚Äîcome be a part of it!

Responsibilities


Identify AI & Automation Opportunities:
Collaborate with various departments to identify areas where AI can add value
Conduct research and analysis to stay updated on the latest AI trends and technologies
Document/map and evaluate current business processes to pinpoint inefficiencies and opportunities for AI & Automation
Technical Requirement Formulation:
Gather and document detailed business requirements for AI & Automation projects
Develop detailed documentation, including use cases, process diagrams, and technical requirements
Guarantee that all documented requirements are unambiguous, succinct, and in alignment with strategic business objectives
Stakeholder Engagement:
Act as a liaison between business units, technical teams, and external partners
Facilitate meetings and workshops to elicit requirements and validate solutions
Communicate effectively with stakeholders to manage expectations and project scope
Data Analysis:
Partner with Data & Analytics to identify AI-ready data sources
Develop dashboards to measure opportunities and support prioritization decisions
Training and Support:
Provide training and support to end-users on new AI systems and tools
Develop user guides and training materials
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to AI & Automation solutions


Qualifications

Required Education, Experience, and Skills


Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related discipline and/or Technical certification with at least 2+ years analyst experience
Professional Experience: A track record of success as a Business and Technical Analyst, with a preference for those who have concentrated on AI & Automation technology projects
Analytical skills: Exceptional analytical abilities, capable of interpreting intricate data and formulating decisions based on data insights
Communication Excellence: Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, ensuring effective interaction and collaboration
Technical Proficiency: Skilled in data analysis and visualization tools, such as Power BI, and whiteboarding tools such as Mural/Miro to conduct discovery and design session with business
AI Familiarity: General understanding of AI technologies and their practical applications within business contexts
Project Management Expertise: Robust project management capabilities, adept at juggling multiple projects and priorities efficiently


Secondary Language(s) Job Description

Who We Are:

Organon delivers ingenious health solutions that enable people to live their best lives. We are a $6.5 billion global healthcare company focused on making a world of difference for women, their families and the communities they care for. We have an important portfolio and are growing it by investing in the unmet needs of Women‚Äôs Health, expanding access to leading biosimilars and touching lives with a diverse and trusted portfolio of health solutions. Our Vision is clear: A better and healthier every day for every woman.

US and PR Residents Only

For more information about personal rights under Equal Employment Opportunity, visit:

EEOC Poster

EEOC GINA Supplement

OFCCP EEO Supplement

OFCCP Pay Transparency Rule

Organon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to fostering a culture of inclusion, innovation, and belonging for all employees and job applicants. We ensure all employment practices are conducted without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state or federal law.

Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully

Organon LLC., does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails.

Applicable to United States Positions Only: Under various U.S. state laws, Organon is required to provide a reasonable estimate of the salary range for this job. Final salary determinations take a number of factors into account including, but not limited to, primary work location, relevant skills, education level, and/or prior work experience. The applicable salary range for this position in the U.S. is stated below. Benefits offered in the U.S. include a retirement savings plan, paid vacation and holiday time, paid caregiver/parental and medical leave, and health benefits including medical, prescription drug, dental, and vision coverage in accordance with the terms and conditions of the applicable plans.

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Description

Who is Defined.ai? Well, from a technical point of view, we leverage the power of a global crowd to provide some of the world‚Äôs biggest companies with the high-quality data they need to power their artificial intelligence. We‚Äôre instrumental to the progression and development of artificial intelligence and we couldn‚Äôt be prouder or more inspired to be involved in an industry that is changing the world.

From a personal point of view, we‚Äôre a group of big thinkers, high achievers and creative problem solvers. We bond over our shared love of software engineering, data science, and strong coffee. We like online gaming, running marathons, and team drinks. We celebrate authenticity and diversity and we‚Äôre invested in what we do. Our mission? World domination, obviously!

What will you do?

  • Design and implement scalable PySpark-based data pipelines to process (clean, validate, package and deliver) multimodal AI training datasets (e.g., text, audio, video, images, etc.);
  • Develop ETL pipelines to fuel the Operations areas with data for their analytical dashboards;
  • Set software engineering tools, platforms, and best practices while performing trade-off analysis to best match engineering, product, and project constraints and expectations;
  • Operate data pipelines to ingest data from multiple sources, and deliver it to different destinations.
  • Help the Product Manager and stakeholders in structuring, breaking down, and prioritizing the product roadmap into backlog work items;
  • Collaborate with other software engineering teams such as SREs and DevOps to achieve your team‚Äôs goals;
  • Work together with Software Engineering teams so as to integrate the Data Platform with other tools and platforms.

Who are we looking for?

Do you have the drive to work in an innovative and ambitious environment?

We‚Äôre looking for someone with a determined and proactive mindset, someone inspired and passionate to help us achieve our goals. Our successful candidate is a strong critical thinker, reliable and transparent, with an ability to learn and communicate. We are looking for someone special to contribute to our unique culture.

  • BSc or MSc in Computer Science or similar background;
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience;
  • Experience in PySpark-based data pipelines and software quality best practices;
  • Worked with Azure services such as Synapse Analytics (mainly PySpark Jobs, Pipelines, and Notebooks), ADLS, Power BI, DevOps, and SQL and NoSQL databases;
  • Solid understanding of data-related architectures, concepts, technologies, and processes (e.g., Medallion, Data Lake, Data Lakehouse, Data Warehouse, ETL, etc.);
  • Comfortable with evaluating and applying software design and architectural patterns/principles;
  • Knowledge of RESTful APIs based on FastAPI, from the provider as well as the consumer point of view;
  • Problem Solving skills;
  • Proficient in both written and spoken English.

Benefits

You spend a lot of your time at work, so it should be challenging, fun and interesting. At Defined.ai it will be all of those things and more. Here‚Äôs what we offer:

  • Flexible working schedule and hybrid model. We know comfort can boost creativity and performance, so you can manage your schedule and work both from one of our modern office spaces or home.
  • Excellent career development opportunities in a high growth company. With us, you can accomplish your career goals and follow a well-described career path with the support of your supervisor.
  • Culture of feedback and continuous improvement. AI is a fast-paced area, so we keep track of tech trends, and we always ask for feedback.
  • An international and diverse team. We have more than 30 nationalities at our 3 locations, and we provide language classes.
  • Continuous training opportunities. You can choose from many options: leveraging hand-on workshops, unlimited access to Udemy and formal development opportunities.
  • We love to have fun together. We joke a lot, and we can't imagine work without fun activities ‚Äì we already surfed, raced carts and played soccer together.

About Us

Defined.ai offers a platform with multiple data delivery options that leverages machine learning technology and human intelligence to deliver quality-guaranteed training data for AI systems. The platform offers self-service and fully customizable solutions that deliver high-quality project-specific training data, enabling AI products reach market quicker. It is this business model that has allowed Defined.ai to raise a total of $63.6M in funding over 4 rounds. Our value proposition is quality, privacy, speed and scale, covering more than 50 different languages. With strong expertise in speech and natural language processing technologies, we have been serving AI companies and Fortune 500 companies since day one. Defined.ai was founded in Seattle and has offices in Lisbon and Porto.

Title: Data Analyst - RISK BCEF
Description:
About The Job


Within the RISK Portugal Hub of CPBS (Commercial, Personal Banking & Services), you will join the RISK BCEF Reporting team. As a RISK Reporting Data Analyst, you will be responsible for producing BCEF‚Äôs RWA (Risk-Weighted Assets) for both monthly and quarterly closings, in cooperation with the RISK BCEF Reporting teams in Paris, BCEF Finance, and Credit Risk Regulatory (CRR) teams in Lisbon. You will also contribute to the production of credit risk reporting and indicators to address increasing regulatory demands and the development of Retail and Corporate securitizations within BCEF
You will be working on various current credit risk and regulatory issues at the heart of banking within the largest entity of CPBS. You will gain a strong understanding of RWA calculations as well as the construction and analysis of key indicators for managing bank‚Äôs credit risk. In general, you will develop expertise in credit risk management, banking regulation (CRR3, EBA Guidelines ‚Äì LOM, NPE-FBE, etc.), and the data challenges within BCEF and RISK BCEF


Your Main Activities Are


During monthly and quarterly financial closings
Production of controls (accounting base, risk parameters EAD/PD/LGD, EL/ELBE shortfall) to critically assess the elements used in capital calculation
Identification of potential anomalies during the capital run and making necessary corrections
Production of dashboards to explain RWA amounts and their variations
Analysis and explanation of results from both an internal and standard approach (following the implementation of Basel 4 in January 2025), including the preparation of presentation materials
Post-financial closings, you will lead work to optimize BCEF‚Äôs RWA
Analyze and track the impact of compensations (RISK/Finance discrepancies) to reduce them in collaboration with the Finance teams in Madrid
Analyze risk parameters (freshness of ratings and RTS36 impacts, limiting risk parameters for defaulted items or those subject to management rules)
Contribute to improving the quality of data used (e.g., analyzing collateral, tracking remediation actions on data quality controls (Defensive and RDI controls), participating in the Data Quality Committee (COMET))
Finally, you will also contribute to the production of risk reporting and indicators
Produce and analyze credit risk indicators for recharges or new securitization vehicles to meet internal and regulatory requirements (including the future SLA between RISK BCEF and ALMT)
Produce regular regulatory reports (e.g., Short Term Exercise, Loan Tape CRE) or ad-hoc reports (e.g., BCE requests) in cooperation with the Paris reporting teams

Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor Degree in Information Technology / Computer Science / Mathematics / Statistics or related
At least 5 years of experience in Data Analytics or similar
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in
Tableau
Power BI
SQL
Ability to deliver / results driven
Ability to manage a project
Ability to synthetise / simplify
Analytical ability
Communication skills, both written and oral

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

HTML:
About The Job

  • Within the RISK Portugal Hub of CPBS (Commercial, Personal Banking & Services), you will join the RISK BCEF Reporting team. As a RISK Reporting Data Analyst, you will be responsible for producing BCEF‚Äôs RWA (Risk-Weighted Assets) for both monthly and quarterly closings, in cooperation with the RISK BCEF Reporting teams in Paris, BCEF Finance, and Credit Risk Regulatory (CRR) teams in Lisbon. You will also contribute to the production of credit risk reporting and indicators to address increasing regulatory demands and the development of Retail and Corporate securitizations within BCEF
  • You will be working on various current credit risk and regulatory issues at the heart of banking within the largest entity of CPBS. You will gain a strong understanding of RWA calculations as well as the construction and analysis of key indicators for managing bank‚Äôs credit risk. In general, you will develop expertise in credit risk management, banking regulation (CRR3, EBA Guidelines ‚Äì LOM, NPE-FBE, etc.), and the data challenges within BCEF and RISK BCEF

Your Main Activities Are

  • During monthly and quarterly financial closings
    • Production of controls (accounting base, risk parameters EAD/PD/LGD, EL/ELBE shortfall) to critically assess the elements used in capital calculation
    • Identification of potential anomalies during the capital run and making necessary corrections
    • Production of dashboards to explain RWA amounts and their variations
    • Analysis and explanation of results from both an internal and standard approach (following the implementation of Basel 4 in January 2025), including the preparation of presentation materials
  • Post-financial closings, you will lead work to optimize BCEF‚Äôs RWA
    • Analyze and track the impact of compensations (RISK/Finance discrepancies) to reduce them in collaboration with the Finance teams in Madrid
    • Analyze risk parameters (freshness of ratings and RTS36 impacts, limiting risk parameters for defaulted items or those subject to management rules)
    • Contribute to improving the quality of data used (e.g., analyzing collateral, tracking remediation actions on data quality controls (Defensive and RDI controls), participating in the Data Quality Committee (COMET))
  • Finally, you will also contribute to the production of risk reporting and indicators
    • Produce and analyze credit risk indicators for recharges or new securitization vehicles to meet internal and regulatory requirements (including the future SLA between RISK BCEF and ALMT)
    • Produce regular regulatory reports (e.g., Short Term Exercise, Loan Tape CRE) or ad-hoc reports (e.g., BCE requests) in cooperation with the Paris reporting teams
Profile and Skills to Success

  • Bachelor Degree in Information Technology / Computer Science / Mathematics / Statistics or related
  • At least 5 years of experience in Data Analytics or similar
  • Advanced level of English, both written and oral
  • Knowledge in
    • Tableau
    • Power BI
    • SQL
  • Ability to deliver / results driven
  • Ability to manage a project
  • Ability to synthetise / simplify
  • Analytical ability
  • Communication skills, both written and oral
Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Center Tools and Reporting Specialist
Description:
Location: Lisbon (with weekly trips to Sines) or Sines

About the job:

We are looking for a Data Center Tools and Reporting Specialist to join our growing Operations team.

In this role, you'll turn raw data into strategic insights, enabling smarter, faster decision-making across the business. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to enhance process efficiency, drive data quality, and deliver impactful visualizations and reports.

You'll also take ownership of selecting, implementing, and managing IT tools that support data analysis and reporting, ensuring our operations are underpinned by the right technology and actionable intelligence.

This is an exciting opportunity to combine your technical data skills with your business mindset to make a measurable difference.

Key Responsibilities:


Collect, clean, and validate data from systems such as CMMS, BMS, EPMS, CRM, ERP, and IoT platforms
Use SQL, Python or R to analyze data, identify trends, and generate insights
Build and maintain reports and dashboards using Excel, Power BI or Tableau
Collaborate with internal teams to define KPIs and reporting requirements
Present insights in a clear, engaging way to non-technical stakeholders
Support analytics initiatives such as forecasting, segmentation, and performance modelling
Monitor and improve data quality, contributing to robust data governance
Enhance IT tools and process flows that support reporting and data-driven decisions


Key Qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or related field
2‚Äì5 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence or similar roles
Strong proficiency in SQL and at least one statistical programming language (Python or R)
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Analytical mindset with attention to detail and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication skills and ability to translate complex data into clear stories
Knowledge of machine learning concepts and data modelling is a plus
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a dynamic environment


Why You'll Love It Here:




Impact: Lead world class operations at Europe's largest and most sustainable data center.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams and contribute to business development.
Flexibility: Empowered to lead with autonomy and creativity in a fast-paced, client-centric environment.
Growth: Join a company committed to innovation, professional development, and service excellence.


About Us:

At Start Campus, we provide mission-critical data center services that power businesses globally. We're customer-centric, innovative, and always looking to push boundaries.

If you're passionate about building relationships, driving customer success, and thriving in a tech-driven world, we want to hear from you!

If you think you have what it takes for this position and are looking for a new professional challenge send your application.

If you think you have what it takes for this position and are looking for a new professional challenge send your application.

Title: Graduates‚Äô Programme 2025 ‚Äì LAB Data Science Graduate
Description:
About The Graduates' Programme‚ÄØ

The BNP Paribas Graduates‚Äô Programme is an exciting opportunity for recent graduates who are eager to start a career in the dynamic world of Banking and Finance. At BNP Paribas, we believe in nurturing and empowering the next generation of leaders to drive innovation and success in the global financial industry.

The Graduates‚Äô Programme 2025 starts on 1 September.

BNP Paribas Graduates‚Äô Programme Highlights


Permanent contracts with BNP Paribas, with access to several benefits
During the first 12 months, the Graduates will complete different professional development assignments across 2 different teams, within the same Business Area


We are recruiting one Graduate to integrate the GM Data and AI Lab Team, within the Global Markets Front Office Business Area.

About The Business Area

Global Markets is BNP Paribas‚Äô capital markets business within Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB), delivering solutions across asset classes, and industry-leading services for clients including Institutional, corporate, private banks and retail distribution networks. Our Portugal Platform (Porto and Lisbon) is a major HUB in Europe and certainly unique in the country by its size and its scope of activity, with all Front Office roles present (Trading, Sales, Research, Structuring, Quant & Engineering, Business Dev and Support, Marketing & Client Support, Risk Management, Data Analytics and Machine Learning‚Ä¶). We are growing fast with the ambition to become even more relevant for the worldwide activity, which presents many short and long-term opportunities.

Check out our VIDEO and get a glimpse into our world.

About The Team

This GM Data and AI Lab is a small team of data scientists applying the latest techniques in Artificial Intelligence, Data modelling and Natural Language Processing to strategic projects for the business.

About The LAB Data Science Graduate‚Äôs Role

During the first year, the Graduate will complete one 6-month rotation in the GM Data and AI Lab Team, followed by a second 6-month rotation in the Quantitative Data Intelligence Team. After completing the 2 rotations, in September 2026, the Graduate will integrate the GM Data and AI Lab Team.

GM Data And AI Lab Team Responsibilities


Explore and examine data from multiple diverse data sources
Conceptual modeling, statistical analysis, predictive modelling and optimization design
Data clean-up, normalization and transformation
Hypothesis testing: being able to develop hypothesis and test with careful experiments
Discover hidden insights/embedded patterns and enable business stakeholders to make decisions that are more informed
Help build workflows for extraction, transformation and loading of different data from a variety of sources and enable linking them to existing systems and datasets


About The Graduate‚Äô Profile And Skills


Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, other science or engineering field
Knowledge of key concepts in Statistics and Mathematics such as Probability Theory, Inference, and Linear Algebra
Knowledge or experience in Machine Learning procedures and tasks such as Classification, Prediction and Clustering
Programming skills in Python and knowledge of common numerical and machine-learning packages (NumPy, Scikit-learn, Pandas, Keras, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Knowledge of data analytics, manipulation and visualization technique
Excellent fluency in English
Availability for a full-time permanent position from 1 September 2025
Maximum of 2 years of working experience (including internships)
Kindly note that candidates that do not meet the requirements will not be considered for this Graduate Sales and Trading Position.


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is a leader in the Eurozone, and a prominent international banking institution with strong roots in Europe's banking history. It has a presence in 65 countries, with around 190 000 Employees ‚Äì including more than 145 000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


Since 1985, BNP Paribas was one of the first foreign banks to operate in the country. Today, the Group has around 7.100 employees across several entities operating directly in the territory, offering a wide range of integrated financial solutions to support its clients and their businesses.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services‚ÄØthat include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking‚ÄØdivision that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

HTML:
About The Graduates' Programme‚ÄØ

The BNP Paribas Graduates‚Äô Programme is an exciting opportunity for recent graduates who are eager to start a career in the dynamic world of Banking and Finance. At BNP Paribas, we believe in nurturing and empowering the next generation of leaders to drive innovation and success in the global financial industry.

The Graduates‚Äô Programme 2025 starts on 1 September.

BNP Paribas Graduates‚Äô Programme Highlights

  • Permanent contracts with BNP Paribas, with access to several benefits
  • During the first 12 months, the Graduates will complete different professional development assignments across 2 different teams, within the same Business Area

We are recruiting one Graduate to integrate the GM Data and AI Lab Team, within the Global Markets Front Office Business Area.

About The Business Area

Global Markets is BNP Paribas‚Äô capital markets business within Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB), delivering solutions across asset classes, and industry-leading services for clients including Institutional, corporate, private banks and retail distribution networks. Our Portugal Platform (Porto and Lisbon) is a major HUB in Europe and certainly unique in the country by its size and its scope of activity, with all Front Office roles present (Trading, Sales, Research, Structuring, Quant & Engineering, Business Dev and Support, Marketing & Client Support, Risk Management, Data Analytics and Machine Learning‚Ä¶). We are growing fast with the ambition to become even more relevant for the worldwide activity, which presents many short and long-term opportunities.

Check out our VIDEO and get a glimpse into our world.

About The Team

This GM Data and AI Lab is a small team of data scientists applying the latest techniques in Artificial Intelligence, Data modelling and Natural Language Processing to strategic projects for the business.

About The LAB Data Science Graduate‚Äôs Role

During the first year, the Graduate will complete one 6-month rotation in the GM Data and AI Lab Team, followed by a second 6-month rotation in the Quantitative Data Intelligence Team. After completing the 2 rotations, in September 2026, the Graduate will integrate the GM Data and AI Lab Team.

GM Data And AI Lab Team Responsibilities

  • Explore and examine data from multiple diverse data sources
  • Conceptual modeling, statistical analysis, predictive modelling and optimization design
  • Data clean-up, normalization and transformation
  • Hypothesis testing: being able to develop hypothesis and test with careful experiments
  • Discover hidden insights/embedded patterns and enable business stakeholders to make decisions that are more informed
  • Help build workflows for extraction, transformation and loading of different data from a variety of sources and enable linking them to existing systems and datasets

About The Graduate‚Äô Profile And Skills

  • Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, other science or engineering field
  • Knowledge of key concepts in Statistics and Mathematics such as Probability Theory, Inference, and Linear Algebra
  • Knowledge or experience in Machine Learning procedures and tasks such as Classification, Prediction and Clustering
  • Programming skills in Python and knowledge of common numerical and machine-learning packages (NumPy, Scikit-learn, Pandas, Keras, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
  • Knowledge of data analytics, manipulation and visualization technique
  • Excellent fluency in English
  • Availability for a full-time permanent position from 1 September 2025
  • Maximum of 2 years of working experience (including internships)
  • Kindly note that candidates that do not meet the requirements will not be considered for this Graduate Sales and Trading Position.

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is a leader in the Eurozone, and a prominent international banking institution with strong roots in Europe's banking history. It has a presence in 65 countries, with around 190 000 Employees ‚Äì including more than 145 000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

Since 1985, BNP Paribas was one of the first foreign banks to operate in the country. Today, the Group has around 7.100 employees across several entities operating directly in the territory, offering a wide range of integrated financial solutions to support its clients and their businesses.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services‚ÄØthat include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking‚ÄØdivision that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

‚ÄØ

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst - GHR
Description:
About The Job

People Analytics is the AI & Analytics center of expertise for HR. Our goal is to support HR teams in leveraging data to help strategically manage activities and improve employee experience. To achieve this, People Analytics use a AI & Analytics platforms for data processing, visualization and AI. People Analytics offers analyses, dashboards, predictive models, and digital solutions that meet the needs of senior management, HR teams, and business units.

Within People Analytics, you will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in Paris and Lisbon in an agile mode. You will work with other data experts (including data quality analysts, data engineers, data scientists) and will be in constant contact with other HR experts.

As a Data Analyst, you will build analyses and participate in the development of projects that help make strategic decisions for the function (e.g. Analyzing workforce trends for the general management).

Your Main Activities Are

In This Role, Your Missions Will Include

Understand the needs expressed by senior management, HR teams, or the business.

Translate them into an analytical roadmap (scope of analysis, metrics...) to help make decisions.

Develop dashboards (Power BI and Tableau) and written analyses (preparation, exploration, descriptive analysis, data visualization, clustering, machine learning, NLP...) in collaboration with data scientists and data engineers of the team.

Contribute to the monitoring and analysis of workforce trends, from data collection to the delivery of analyses to senior management.

Clearly communicate actionable recommendations orally and in writing through reliable and quality deliverables.

Your Team / Work Environment

This position is to be filled within the People Analytics team at Group HR;

You will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in an agile mode with all the AI&Analytics experts (Data Analyst, Data Engineer, AI Business Analyst, Data project manager, Data Scientist, Data quality analyst, Product Owner‚Ä¶), and will be in contact with other HR department collaborators.

And after? / FUTURE PROSPECTS:

The numerous contacts you will gain will allow you to develop your network and consider joining different teams within GHR or more broadly within the group's businesses.

Profile And Skills To Success

With a scientific background, you have experience as an analyst, management controller, auditor, consultant in a quantitative-oriented position.

Pedagogically, you can communicate your statistical analyses and results clearly and intelligibly to different stakeholders, both in writing and orally, adapting to the technical levels expected by your interlocutors.

You have significant experience in data visualization, data preparation and machine-learning.

Finally, we attach particular importance to our future collaborators acting with responsibility and professional ethics daily.

Your Required Skills

Business Skills:

Data Processing (Expert)

Data Analysis (Expert)

Knowledge of BNP Paribas organization (Proficient)

Knowledge of Human Resources (Proficient)

Knowledge of Data (Proficient)

Data Quality and Security (Expert)

Transversal Skills

Ability to understand, explain, and lead change (Proficient)

Analytical Skills (Expert)

Project Management Skills (Expert)

Ability to lead meetings, seminars, committees and trainings (Proficient)

Ability to define relevant performance indicators (Expert)

Behavioral Skills

Ability to synthesize/simplify (Expert)

Communication Skills ‚Äì oral and written (Expert)

Adaptability (Proficient)

Results-oriented (Expert)

Problem-solving Skills (Proficient)

Languages

English (Advanced)

Tools / Technologies / Methodologies

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Tableau (Expert)

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS DataIKU (Proficient)

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Power BI (Proficient)

Python (Proficient)

DATABASE MANAGEMENT Standard SQL (Proficient)

AGILE Methodology (Proficient)

MS OFFICE PACK MICROSOFT EXCEL Tools (Proficient)

Mobility is one of the core principles of BNP Paribas career and management strategy, which aims to meet our Employees‚Äô needs for personal development along with ensuring that the company meets the overall business needs. For further details, we invite you to explore the mobility principles available on https://bwelcome.hr.bnpparibas/internalmobility. Before applying, please make sure you discuss it with your manager whose support is critical

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good.

Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Engineer to join our team. If you have a passion for working with large data sets, creating efficient pipelines, and turning data into actionable insights, we want to meet you!

Responsibilities


Develop and maintain scalable, reliable, and efficient data pipelines.
Optimize the collection, storage, and processing of large data volumes.
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand the company‚Äôs data needs.
Ensure data quality, integrity, and security.
Implement data storage solutions in cloud, hybrid, or on-premises environments.


Qualifications


Experience with Spark (PySpark), Cloudera, SQL, Hive/Impala, Datawarehouse/Data lake
Fuent in English

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
At Flix, we offer a tech-driven environment where innovation meets real-world impact, with competitive pay, strong growth opportunities, and a culture of collaboration and ownership.‚ÄØ

We are trailblazers in data-driven marketing. We firmly believe that successful marketing is rooted in high-quality data, and our commitment to support marketing teams with reliable data solutions is what sets us apart. You will work in a talented team of data engineers, data scientists & a product owner, delivering data products and models that empower marketing teams to take optimal budget steering decisions.

About The Role


Use Python, SQL, and Airflow to design and maintain robust, scalable data pipelines that deliver timely, actionable insights to marketing stakeholders.
Apply analytical thinking to understand complex data requirements and translate them into efficient data pipelines.
Ensure data quality through validation, monitoring, and clear documentation.
Proactively debug and refactor data pipelines to enhance performance, accuracy, and maintainability, based on a solid understanding of the underlying business logic.
Participate in code reviews and contribute to engineering best practices within the team.
Collaborate with the Product Owner and cross-functional teams to understand marketing stakeholders' data needs and translate them into technical solutions.
Assist with ad hoc requests and help resolve data-related issues by applying both technical and analytical problem-solving skills.
Participate in the continuous improvement of data infrastructure by optimizing pipeline performance, enhancing data models, and integrating scalable, future-proof solutions.


About You


You‚Äôve had hands-on experience with Python, SQL, and Git.
You hold a degree in Computer Science or a related field. Candidates from Business or Marketing backgrounds with strong technical experience are also welcome.
You think critically, ask insightful questions, and enjoy turning complex business requirements into clean, effective code.
You are experienced with relational databases and excel at writing complex SQL queries.
You thrive in team settings, communicate well, and are fluent in English.
Bonus: Experience with Airflow, AWS, terraform, CI/CD tools; having worked in Marketing Domain.


We recognize that everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences. If you think you could have an impact even though you don't meet 100% of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply. We want to hear from you!‚ÄØ

What We Offer


Travel perks: 12 free Flix vouchers + 12 discount vouchers for friends & family.
Work from (M)Anywhere: Depending on your role, work from another location for up to 60 days per year.
Hybrid work model: We are an office-first company, but we offer flexibility to balance work and life.
Wellbeing support: Access confidential 1:1 counselling, courses, and stress management for yourself and up to four family members.
Learning & Development: Take advantage of language classes, training courses, and expert-led sessions to grow your skills.
Mentoring Program: Connect with experienced colleagues to gain insights and accelerate your career.


To view more local benefits specific to each office location, please check out this link: Locations - Flix Career

Why Join Flix?

At Flix, we empower our teams to push boundaries and shape the future of mobility. As we continue to scale globally, we harness cutting-edge technology to make mobility smarter, more sustainable, and more affordable.

If you‚Äôre looking for a place where you can drive change and redefine how millions of people travel, Flix is the place where you can lead your journey!

Title: Predictive Modeling Specialist
Description:
About Us



Indie Campers, the go-to campervan Marketplace, is on a mission of making road trips available to everyone. Thanks to its digital approach and customer-centric orientation, Indie Campers has developed a strong booking experience and high-quality road trips at affordable prices.

With over one million nights rented through our travel platform, we have welcomed more than 300,000 travelers from 169 countries. We offer a comprehensive and expanding array of road trip possibilities: short-term RV rentals, long-term campervan subscriptions, and the possibility of buying one of our vehicles available for sale.

Rooted in a deep technological focus, our challenges are both exciting and demanding and require top talent and motivation to be successfully pursued. We are growing our team and looking for those interested in pursuing this dream with us and joining an ever-developing journey.

THE ROLE

As Indie Campers' Predictive Modeling Specialist you will be in charge of creating and developing predictive models and algorithms to assist decision making, anticipate issues and detect opportunities.

You will report directly to the Own Fleet Director and work very closely with our Data, Product, Ecommerce, Pricing, Stock, Finance, and Marketing teams from our Lisbon, Portugal HQ.

WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON?

You'll be responsible for creating and developing key capabilities that will make Indie Campers increasingly more data-driven.

The right candidate will:


Lead the creation and development of predictive models and algorithms.
Support forecasting and budgeting efforts with advanced analysis
Develop an E2E process of Models & Algorithms creation for Indie Campers.
Work constantly with model's end users to continously optimize them, making them increasingly more complete.
Oversee and detect which departments and areas could benefit more from the application of these tools in their activities.
Develop analysis tools to control and measure the impact of the predictive models and algorithms usage.
Together with Data, collect data, cleaning it, organising it, and search for customers behaviour patterns and what influences it.
Firslty focus on developing these capabilities for the Revenue department to then expand it company wide.


WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

You are fluent in English, spoken and written, with a Bachelor's or Master's in Finance, Mathematics, Engineering or Physics. You have minimum 4 years of professional experience, and previous involvement in algorithms and models creation or development.

Experience in working with large Datasets (SQL) and different data sources. Experience in using Python for scripting, data management and writing algorithms.

You'll lead the creation of tools and mechanism capable to automate decision making and improve our capability to react faster and plan ahead.

Are you ready to Go Indie?

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/*)
Description:
Our Engineering community is growing, and we‚Äôre now looking for a Data Engineer to join our team supporting our global growth.

As Data Engineer, you design and optimize data processing algorithms on a talented, cross-functional team. You are familiar with the Apache open-source suite of technologies and want to contribute to the advancement of data engineering.

What We Offer


A chance to accelerate your career and work with outstanding colleagues in a supportive learning community split across 3 continents
Contribute your ideas to our unique projects and make an impact by turning them into reality
Balance your work and personal life through our workflow organization and decide yourself if you work‚ÄØat home, in the office, or on a hybrid setup
Annual performance review, and regular feedback cycles, generating distinct value by connecting colleagues through networks rather than hierarchies
Individual development plan, professional development opportunities
Educational resources such as paid certifications, unlimited access to Udemy Business, etc.
Local, virtual, and global team events, in which UT colleagues become acquainted with one another


What You‚Äôll Do


Support the development and maintenance of data pipelines and ETL processes, with a focus on learning and applying Databricks technologies.
Assist in data ingestion, transformation, and validation tasks across structured and semi-structured sources.
Participate in team code reviews, documentation, and knowledge-sharing sessions to build Databricks proficiency.
Collaborate with senior engineers to implement scalable solutions and gradually take ownership of Databricks workflows.
Contribute to improving data quality, observability, and operational efficiency.


What You‚Äôll Bring


Solid foundation in SQL and Python, with a strong interest in distributed data processing and cloud platforms.
Eagerness to learn Databricks, Apache Spark, and modern data engineering practices.
Familiarity with version control (e.g., Git) and basic understanding of cloud services (Azure, AWS, or GCP).
Analytical mindset, attention to detail, and a collaborative attitude.
Motivation to grow into a Databricks expert through hands-on experience and mentorship.
Professional communications skills in English


Did we pique your interest, or do you have any questions?

We want to hear from you: contact us at recruit@ultratendency.com

About Us

Ultra Tendency is an international premier Data Engineering consultancy for Big Data, Cloud, Streaming, IIoT and Microservices. We design, build, and operate large-scale data-driven applications for major enterprises such as the European Central Bank, HUK-Coburg, Deutsche Telekom, and Europe‚Äôs largest car manufacturer. Founded in Germany in 2010, UT has developed a reliable client base and now runs 8 branches in 7 countries across 3 continents.

We do more than just leverage tech, we build it. At Ultra Tendency we contribute source code to +20 open-source projects including Ansible, Terraform, NiFi, and Kafka. Our impact on tech and business is there for anyone to see. Enterprises seek out Ultra Tendency because we solve the problems others cannot.

We love the challenge: together, we tackle diverse and unique projects you will find nowhere else. In our knowledge community, you will be a part of a supportive network, not a hierarchy. Constant learning and feedback are our drivers for stable development. With us you can develop your individual career through work-life balance.

We evaluate your application based on your skills and corresponding business requirements. Ultra Tendency welcomes applications from qualified candidates regardless of race, ethnicity, national or social origin, disability, sex, sexual orientation, or age.

Data privacy statement: Data Protection for Applicants ‚Äì Ultra Tendency

Title: Product Analyst - ComparaJ√°
Description:
About us

Our mission is to help consumers save time and money by matching them with the best products for their banking, insurance, and utility needs. We work towards becoming the largest distributor of financial services. ComparaJ√°.pt is part of Samlino Group (https://samlinogroup.com/). We operate across four markets, empowering users reach healthier financial lives.

What we offer you

You'll have the unique opportunity to be a key driver of our exponential growth curve. In your daily work, you will work directly with our Founder and senior teams.

Sunny Lisbon will be your home base, but you'll travel between our four markets (Portugal, Denmark, Belgium and Greece)!

Your Responsibilities

You will be accountable for your own projects and will be responsible for driving results across various ventures and initiatives. Your responsibilities in this job will evolve and be defined and redefined throughout your time with us. The aim is to take ownership of and drive the development of progressively larger opportunities.

What we expect from you

We are looking for a dynamic individual who thrives in a results-oriented environment to join our team and help us reach our objectives. Industry experience is not a requirement, but you do need to be highly ambitious, proactive, forward-thinking, a fast learner, and driven to succeed.

Furthermore, we are looking for candidates who:


Have a proactive mindset, strong analytical skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
Are self-motivated, detail-oriented, and possess a track record of successfully owning projects from conception to completion
Possess an unwavering drive and desire to be the very best at what they do
Are passionate about making an impact and driving tangible results
Exude a strong work ethic fueled by an urgency to progress
Embrace ownership and proactively follow through on commitments
Possess an insatiable curiosity about business, data, and people, relishing the opportunity to build and nurture relationships that fuel lasting success
Master communication, wielding words with impact both verbally and in writing
Showcase unrivalled organisational skills, skillfully structuring and prioritising their work to achieve maximum efficiency
Native proficiency in either Portuguese or Danish and fluent in English
EU work permit is required


Start date and Location

Flexible start date

This role is full-time onsite at our Lisbon office
